data.title: My Indices : Real-Time Metrics DAG
data.description:
Implement a dag that runs as close to real-time as feasible, which computes the following metrics for each user's bought Index :

* Current Value ($)
* PnL ($)
* ROI (%)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Real-Time Metrics DAG for User Indices

**Description:**  
Develop a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) that operates in near real-time to calculate key metrics for each user's purchased index, specifically Current Value ($), Profit and Loss (PnL) ($), and Return on Investment (ROI) (%).

**Business Rationale:**  
Providing real-time metrics enhances user engagement and satisfaction by offering timely insights into their investments. This enables users to make informed decisions quickly, thereby increasing platform trust and usage.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The DAG executes with minimal delay to ensure metrics are updated in near real-time.
* Accurately calculates Current Value, PnL, and ROI for each user's bought index.
* Metrics are accessible to users within a defined time frame after data updates.
* The system handles errors gracefully and includes logging for monitoring.
* Performance is optimized to handle the expected volume of users and indices.

data.title: Feedback Analysis to prioritize post types and enhance the prompt templates based on the feedbacks
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enhance Post Prioritization and Prompt Templates through Feedback Analysis

**Description:**  
Conduct a comprehensive analysis of user feedback to prioritize the most effective post types and improve prompt templates within the Engagement Analysis Pipeline for the X Agent. This enhancement aims to optimize content strategies and increase user engagement.

**Business Rationale:**  
By prioritizing high-impact post types and refining prompt templates based on actual user feedback, we can deliver more relevant and engaging content. This will lead to improved user interactions, higher satisfaction rates, and better overall performance of the X Agent, driving increased business value.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Collected and analyzed user feedback to identify top-performing post types.
* Developed a prioritized list of post types based on feedback insights.
* Reviewed and enhanced existing prompt templates using feedback data.
* Integrated the updated post prioritization and prompt templates into the Engagement Analysis Pipeline for the X Agent.
* Demonstrated improved engagement metrics post-implementation.

data.title: Engagement Analysis Pipeline for X Agent
data.description:
Implement a data collection pipeline that allows pulling engagement-related metrics for each post type (eg. # of replies, likes, shares, etc). This will allow us to understand the usage of the agent on X, and optimize the deployed pipeline accordingly. 

Few insights we can derive from this include :

1. The preferred style of writing 
2. The engagement time (when do users interact with the post type?)
3. The preferred post type (most important - which posts are of higher interest? maybe we can schedule them to run more frequently?)

data.title: Implement MCP Server for Token Metrics API with Full Endpoint Coverage
data.description:
Description:

To enhance AI compatibility and streamline integration with AI-driven systems, we need to create a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Token Metrics API (ref: [https://developers.tokenmetrics.com](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com)). The MCP will expose all available API endpoints (e.g., market data, token info, trend indicators, etc.) to allow AI models to dynamically discover and interact with them without custom integrations. This will position our API as a comprehensive, plug-and-play solution for AI developers, aligning with emerging standards and boosting adoption.

Goals:

* Enable seamless AI integration with all Token Metrics API endpoints.
* Support dynamic resource/tool discovery for the full API surface (e.g., /v2/tokens, /v2/market-indicator, /v2/all-trend-indicators, etc.).
* Future-proof the API for MCP-compatible ecosystems (e.g., Claude Desktop).

Priority: Medium

Assignee: \[API Team/Lead Developer Name\]

Labels: API, MCP, AI-Integration

Tasks:

1. Research MCP Framework
   * Review MCP specs (e.g., client-server setup, resource/tool definitions).
   * Test existing MCP implementations (e.g., Python SDK, Claude Desktop client).
2. Define MCP Scope for Token Metrics API
   * Map all endpoints from [https://developers.tokenmetrics.com](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com) (e.g., /v2/tokens, /v2/market-indicator, /v2/all-trend-indicators, etc.).
   * Categorize as resources (read-only data, e.g., token lists) or tools (actions, if applicable).
   * Document limitations (e.g., rate limits, auth requirements).
3. Set Up MCP Server
   * Choose a base framework (e.g., Python MCP SDK or custom Node.js server).
   * Wrap all API endpoints in MCP-compatible format (JSON responses, discovery metadata).
   * Implement authentication (reuse API key system from Token Metrics).
4. Test Integration
   * Connect MCP server to a test AI client (e.g., Claude Desktop or custom script).
   * Verify dynamic discovery and functionality of all endpoints (e.g., token IDs, market trends).
   * Debug edge cases (e.g., rate limits, malformed requests).
5. Document and Deploy
   * Update [https://developers.tokenmetrics.com](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com) with MCP setup guide and examples.
   * Deploy MCP server alongside existing API infrastructure.
   * Announce availability to users (e.g., newsletter, dev portal).

Acceptance Criteria:

* MCP server is live and accessible via a public endpoint.
* AI client can discover and query all Token Metrics API endpoints without custom code.
* Documentation is updated with MCP instructions and examples.
* No disruption to existing API functionality.

Risks:

* Resource overhead for maintaining dual API/MCP systems.
* Security concerns with broader AI access—mitigate with strict auth and rate limits.
* Limited initial adoption if MCP ecosystem grows slower than expected.

Where to Publish:

* Primary Location: Publish the MCP server details on your existing developer portal at [https://developers.tokenmetrics.com](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com). Add a dedicated “MCP Integration” section alongside current API docs, including:
  * MCP server endpoint URL (e.g., [mcp.tokenmetrics.com](http://mcp.tokenmetrics.com)).
  * Setup instructions for AI clients.
  * Example queries (e.g., fetching token data or market indicators via MCP).
* Additional Channels:
  * Announce via Token Metrics newsletter and socials (e.g., X, Discord) to reach developers.
  * Submit to MCP community hubs (e.g., GitHub repos or forums) if available, to tap into the ecosystem.

Next Steps:

* Assign to team and prioritize in sprint planning.
* Evaluate performance post-launch for scalability tweaks.

Resources:

[https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers)

[https://blog.cloudflare.com/remote-model-context-protocol-servers-mcp/](https://blog.cloudflare.com/remote-model-context-protocol-servers-mcp/)

[Building Agents with Model Context Protocol - Full Workshop with Mahesh Murag of Anthropic](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kQmXtrmQ5Zg&ab_channel=AIEngineer)

[Model Context Protocol (MCP), clearly explained (why it matters)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7j_NE6Pjv-E&ab_channel=GregIsenberg)

comments.body: @talhacagri added more context on MCPs in the ticket. If you need help deploying please leverage @divine or @peterson to deploy this to Digital Ocean droplet.
@vasilis reassigned to Talha. Please connect with him on this.
@divine any idea why they're no auto requests for peer reviews for the above PR?

@talhacagri could you please review this initial draft PR from Codegen and share any feedback.

[https://github.com/token-metrics/tm-data-api/pull/10](https://github.com/token-metrics/tm-data-api/pull/10)

I've created a draft PR implementing the MCP Server for Token Metrics API with full endpoint coverage: [PR #10](https://github.com/token-metrics/tm-data-api/pull/10)

The implementation includes:

- A Python-based MCP server that wraps all Token Metrics API endpoints
- Resources for API documentation and coin listings
- Tools for accessing all API endpoints (market data, token info, trend indicators, etc.)
- Prompts for token analysis and comparison
- Docker configuration for easy deployment
- Example client for demonstration

The server enables AI models to dynamically discover and interact with all Token Metrics API endpoints without custom integrations, making it compatible with Claude Desktop and other MCP-compatible AI systems.

To test it locally:
1. Clone the repository
2. Install dependencies: `pip install -r requirements.txt`
3. Set your Token Metrics API key in a `.env` file
4. Run the server: `python mcp_server.py`

Let me know if you'd like any changes or have questions about the implementation!

*[💻 View my work](https://codegen.sh/agent/trace/1852) • React 👍 or 👎*

@harshg could you please prioritize this task this week as the hackathon is next week?

data.title: Trading Agent - Data Preparation - Transaction History Table
data.description:
**Prepare data to display this table**
**Requirements:**

* Data is stored in PostgreSQL
* **Table 1 (transaction table):**
  * `id` (transaction_id)
  * `tm_chain_id`
  * `action_type` (swap / transfer / deposit, ...)
  * `created_at`
* **Table 2 (transaction detail):**
  * `id`
  * `transaction_id`
  * `tm_token_id`
  * `address`
  * `value`
  * `amount` (nullable)
  * `action` (from / to)
  * `created_at`

**Note:**
`token_image`, `name`, and `symbol` will be joined from the token table, and follow on database redesign

The display logic will fetch data from `transaction_detail`, join with the `transaction` table, and then group by `transaction_id`.

[trading agent - TMAI_task (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=10075-54672&t=wlX3Jj89MvWIOmpe-4)

data.title: Implement JAROWINKLER_SIMILARITY UDF Function To StarRocks
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue: Implement Jaro-Winkler Similarity UDF in StarRocks**

**Description:**
Develop a User-Defined Function (UDF) for calculating Jaro-Winkler similarity to enable string similarity operations within StarRocks SQL queries.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing StarRocks with Jaro-Winkler similarity allows for more effective fuzzy matching, data deduplication, and improved search capabilities, thereby increasing data quality and user satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The Jaro-Winkler similarity UDF is implemented and available in StarRocks.
* The function accurately computes similarity scores in accordance with the standard Jaro-Winkler algorithm.
* Comprehensive unit tests are provided, covering typical and edge case scenarios.
* Documentation includes usage instructions and examples.
* The UDF meets performance benchmarks without significant impact on query execution times.
* Code has been reviewed and approved by the development team.

data.title: Create Token Metrics AI SDK (Python)
data.description:
**Goal:** Develop a lightweight, open-source SDK for the TM API to simplify integration for developers (e.g., Typescript or Python) for quick deployment.

**Steps**

* **Choose a Language:** Start with Python, as it’s widely used in crypto development, easy to learn, and aligns with the TM API’s potential use cases (e.g., trading bots, dashboards).
* **Create the SDK:**
  * Use a simple structure: Create a Python package (e.g., tmai-api) with modules for authentication, market data, and trading signals.
  * Include functions like get_market_data(symbol, timeframe), get_trading_signal(pair), and execute_trade(exchange, params) (simplified versions based on TM API docs).
  * Use requests or httpx for HTTP requests to the TM API, and pydantic for data validation (optional for simplicity).
* **Documentation:** Add docstrings to functions and create a README.md in the SDK repo with installation instructions (pip install tmai-api) and usage examples.
* **Publish:** Host the SDK on GitHub as a separate repo (e.g., github.com/tokenmetrics/tmai-sdk-python) or within the tmai-api repo as a subdirectory. 
  
  Use PyPI for distribution (optional, but quick to set up with twine).
* **Testing:** Include basic unit tests (e.g., using unittest or pytest) to ensure functions work with sample API responses (mock data if needed).
* **Tools Needed:** Python (free), GitHub, PyPI (optional), and basic knowledge of Python packaging (e.g., setup.py or pyproject.toml).

A minimal Python SDK with 2–3 functions can be built in 2–3 days by a developer familiar with Python. Focus on simplicity—avoid complex features like error handling or advanced authentication unless time allows.

data.title: [Staging-Automation] Missing Data in Trading Agent Grade – Only % Symbol Displayed
data.description:
**Description:**
In the **Trading Agent Grade** section, no data is being displayed. Instead, only the **%** symbol appears, without any actual value. This results in an incomplete display and prevents users from understanding the performance or grade of the trading agents.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the **Trading Agent Grade** section.
2. Observe that no actual data is displayed in the grade field, and only a **%** symbol is visible.
3. Notice that the expected value (such as a grade or percentage score) is missing.
4. [https://jam.dev/c/8296de19-4ce3-4884-9bce-bb758f094c23](https://jam.dev/c/8296de19-4ce3-4884-9bce-bb758f094c23)

data.title: Step4: Building pipeline mapping from starrock to the postgres
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Build Pipeline Mapping from StarRocks to PostgreSQL

**Description:**  
Develop a data pipeline to facilitate the migration of data from StarRocks to PostgreSQL. This pipeline should ensure seamless and accurate data transfer, maintaining data integrity and consistency throughout the process.

**Business Rationale:**  
Migrating data to PostgreSQL is essential for enhancing data accessibility, enabling better integration with existing systems, and supporting advanced analytics capabilities. A reliable migration pipeline will minimize downtime, reduce the risk of data loss, and ensure that business operations continue smoothly during the transition.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A fully functional pipeline is established that transfers data from StarRocks to PostgreSQL.
* Data integrity and consistency are verified post-migration with no discrepancies.
* The pipeline handles data transformations as required without errors.
* Comprehensive testing is completed, including performance and reliability assessments.
* Documentation is provided detailing the pipeline architecture, usage instructions, and maintenance guidelines.
* Successful migration is validated by stakeholders and approved for production use.

data.title: Step3: Replace the Bitquery within trading agent project
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Replace BitQuery with Web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py) in Trading AI Agents

**Description:**  
Migrate the data fetching functionality in the V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways from BitQuery to using web3 libraries and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py). This update aims to enhance data retrieval efficiency and reduce dependencies on third-party services.

**Business Rationale:**  
Transitioning to web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py) will improve system performance, provide greater control over data processing, and decrease reliance on external APIs. This change is expected to increase reliability, lower costs, and facilitate easier maintenance and scalability of the trading agent project.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All BitQuery integrations are fully removed from the codebase.
* Data fetching is successfully implemented using web3 and [Solana.py](http://Solana.py).
* Existing functionalities dependent on BitQuery are tested and verified to work with the new data sources.
* Comprehensive tests pass without introducing regressions.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the new data fetching methods.
* Deployment is completed without issues related to the migration.

* The pipeline successfully processes and outputs clean, standardized data without errors.

* Documentation is updated to reflect the new pipeline architecture and usage.

data.title: VectorBT : Implement the correct Max Size Logic using from_signals
data.description:
This is relevant to the follow-up research required, as noted in the parent ticket's comments

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve Max Size Logic in VectorBT Using `from_signals`

**Description:**
Implement the correct maximum position size logic within the VectorBT framework by utilizing the `from_signals` method. This enhancement ensures that trading strategies adhere to predefined size constraints, promoting consistent and controlled execution.

**Business Rationale:**
Accurate position sizing is essential for effective risk management and strategy performance. By addressing the Max Size logic, we can prevent over-allocation of resources, minimize potential losses, and increase the reliability of automated trading strategies built with VectorBT.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The `from_signals` method correctly enforces the maximum position size as defined.
* Existing trading strategies operate without exceeding the specified size limits.
* All related unit tests pass, and new tests are added to validate the Max Size functionality.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the changes in position sizing logic.

parent.title: Resolve Max Size Issue in VectorBT

comments.body: Priority is low for this, as we'll be prioritizing launching the indices as they are. Moving this to next cycle

Some extra context here :

This is a conversation I had with the creator of Vectorbt.

Me : quick question - in from_orders, if I set the size type to targetpercent and also set a max_size of 10_000, would it essentially set the max size to 10,000%? If so, how could I specify the max size to be in value?

Him : size_type is applied to all size arguments, there's no way of specifying size_type just for max_size. In from_signals you could set size dynamically by converting your size and max_size to amount first, but from_orders doesn't support callbacks (https://vectorbt.pro/pvt_7a467f6b/documentation/portfolio/from-signals/)

Me : Not sure whether from_signals will suffice for what I need to achieve, as I cannot configure the sizes in amount prior simulation (as the amount is path-dependent). I'll use ChatVBT to figure it out and revert here if needed. On that, I am trying to set it up yet it's still loading (see attached). Is this normal?

\*\* Fyi, this will be my prompt : 

I have a dataframe of close prices and a dataframe of target weights, represented in percent (eg. 0.25 is 25%). How can I simulate a portfolio that starts with 10k and allocates respective to these weights? Keep in mind that the weight (a) is either positive or zero (no allocation), and (b) can change during a position, thus require rebalancing (eg. it can be 0.25 at the start of the position, but it can change to 0.18 later, thus requiring the position to decrease). Apart from those, how can I enforce the positions to not exceed 10k in value?

Him : You don't need to configure the sizes prior to the simulation, from_signals allows you to set sizes dynamically where you can decide, at each timestamp, which size to order

Him : I recommend going to the documentation on from_signals that I linked previously. You can convert your target percent to amount using amount = vbt.pf_nb.get_order_size_nb(c, size_in_percent, size_type=vbt.pf_enums.SizeType.TargetPercent)
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Update `coingecko_token_exchange` Pipeline to Meet Engineering Team Requirements
data.description:
### **Title:** Update `coingecko_token_exchange` Pipeline to Meet Engineering Team Requirements

### **Description:**

The `coingecko_token_exchange` pipeline needs updates to align with the latest requirements from the Engineering team. Specifically:

* Ensure that Bitcoin (BTC) and Solana (SOL) tokens fetch their `chain_id` from LiFi.
* Maintain existing behavior for other tokens.
* Ensure that the changes do not introduce discrepancies in token mappings or data integrity.
* Validate that the pipeline continues to function without performance regressions.

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* The pipeline correctly pulls `chain_id` from LiFi for BTC and SOL.
* Other tokens remain unaffected in terms of `chain_id` sourcing.
* Unit and integration tests validate the correctness of the implementation.
* The pipeline runs successfully in staging and production environments.

### **Technical Notes:**

* The current pipeline logic should be reviewed to identify where `chain_id` is determined.
* LiFi API integration might be needed if not already implemented.
* Consider handling potential rate limits or API failures from LiFi.

data.title: Research LiFi Platform to Understand API for Retrieving Chain Information
data.description:
Research LiFi Platform to Understand API for Retrieving Chain Information

### **Description:**

Conduct an initial research on the **LiFi platform** to understand its API capabilities for retrieving blockchain-related information. The goal is to explore available endpoints, authentication methods, supported chains, and data structures. This research will help determine how LiFi can be integrated into our system for querying chain-related data.

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Identify and document available LiFi API endpoints relevant to chain information.
* Understand the authentication process (API keys, OAuth, etc.).
* List supported blockchain networks and any limitations.
* Explore response structures for key endpoints (e.g., chain status, transactions, bridges).
* Identify any rate limits or pricing considerations.
* Summarize findings with potential use cases for integration.

### **Technical Considerations:**

* Check if LiFi provides REST, GraphQL, or WebSocket APIs.
* Compare API capabilities with alternative solutions if applicable.
* Evaluate whether additional configurations (e.g., SDKs, webhooks) are required for optimal integration.

### **Deliverables:**

* A research document summarizing key findings.
* Example API calls and responses.
* Recommendations for next steps based on feasibility.

###

data.title: Develop Script to Automate Retrieval, Aggregation, and Mapping of LIFI Chain IDs with CoinGecko Chain IDs
data.description:
**Description:**

1. **Ensure that both EVM and non-EVM SEI token types are correctly retrieved and displayed in the swap widget.**
2. **Verify whether the chain IDs used in the system match those listed in the **[**LIFI supported chains documentation**](https://docs.li.fi/list-chains-bridges-dex-aggregators-solvers)**.**
3. **If any discrepancies exist, update the chain IDs accordingly.**
4. **While the update is not urgent, aim to complete it within the week.**
5. **If immediate fixes are not possible, add the task to the backlog for later resolution.**

Develop Script to Automate Retrieval, Aggregation, and Mapping of LIFI Chain IDs with CoinGecko Chain IDs

### **Description:**

Currently, LIFI Chain IDs and CoinGecko Chain IDs need to be manually mapped, which is inefficient and prone to errors. This task involves developing a script to:

1. **Retrieve** the latest LIFI Chain IDs programmatically.
2. **Aggregate** LIFI Chain IDs with their metadata.
3. **Map** LIFI Chain IDs to the corresponding CoinGecko Chain IDs.
4. **Output** the mapping in a structured format (e.g., JSON or CSV).

### **Requirements:**

* Use an API or dataset to programmatically fetch LIFI Chain IDs.
* Identify an approach to match LIFI Chain IDs with CoinGecko Chain IDs (e.g., by name, symbol, or other metadata).
* Store the final mapping in a structured format (JSON, CSV, or database).
* Ensure the script is idempotent and can be scheduled to run periodically.

[List: Chains, Bridges, DEX Aggregators, Solvers | LI.FI Documentation](https://docs.li.fi/list-chains-bridges-dex-aggregators-solvers)

data.title: Create Real Time Grades
data.description:
Create real-time grades based on the orderbook data we get from BitQuery. Various grading formulas should be implemented and evaluated, with features including: 

1. Net Volume 

```
Defined as : Sum of buy volume - Sum of sell volume

The net volume can be used as simply as :

- Net Volume > 0 → More buying pressure (bullish)
- Net Volume < 0 → More selling pressure (bearish)

Then to formulate a grade, we simply compare the net volume across different tokens
```

2. VWAP (Volume-weighted average price)

```
Defined as : sum(price x amount) / sum(amount)

Interpretation:
- If the current price is above VWAP, the market is strong (buyers in control).
- If the current price is below VWAP, the market is weak (sellers in control).

Then to formulate a grade, we simply compute the difference between the 
price and the VWAP. The more positive it is, the better the grade.
```

3. Maker Activity

```
Defined as : total makers buying / total makers

Intepretation:
- If makers are mostly buying, it suggests passive accumulation.
- If makers are mostly selling, it suggests distribution.

Then to formulate a grade, we rank the tokens by the maker activity. 
The higher it is, the better the grade.
```

4. Market Pressure (Buy/Sell Ratio)

```
Defined as : sum(buy amount) / sum(sell amount)

Interpretation:
- Ratio > 1 → More buyers than sellers (bullish).
- Ratio < 1 → More sellers than buyers (bearish).

Then to formulate a grade, we rank the tokens by the market pressure ratio. 
The higher it is, the better the grade.
```

All of the abovementioned metrics will fluctuate differently, for different time intervals. My opinion is that we should see the derived performance of each, and all of them combined (possibly in a weighted way), across the following time intervals:

```
Short-term : 1-min, 5-min, 15-min (applicable for HFT)

Medium-term : Hourly, 4-hour (applicable for intraday trading, potentially useful for the Trading Agents)

Long-term : Daily, Weekly (potentially useful for Investor Grades)
```

We can take this a step further to create a composite grade that consists of the `average grade across all time intervals`. This can enhance the grade quality as it incorporates all intervals, essentially depicting the token's quality across all timeframes. My view though is that we should have separate grades. Further insights will be added in this ticket as the implementation gets processed.

comments.body: Fully occupied with the Indices right now, will be resuming on this during next cycle

Correct - initially each grade will serve its own purpose, depending on the timeframe it's calculated on. We may consider **ensembling** them (i.e. incorporating the momentum/activity across different timeframes into one grade), yet this has to be explored further.

@vasilis thanks for this, moving to urgent priority.

When you say separate grades, do you mean separate Trader Grades for each time interval?

data.description:
created, active, inactive.

Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Add Bot Status Columns to Track Current States

**Description:**
Implement additional status columns in the bot management interface to display each bot's current state: "Created," "Active," and "Inactive."

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing visibility of bot statuses allows the Data Team to effectively monitor and manage Trading AI Agents. This facilitates quicker identification of inactive or malfunctioning bots, improves overall system reliability, and supports efficient error handling within the V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. A new "Status" column is added to the bot management interface.
2. Each bot is accurately labeled as "Created," "Active," or "Inactive" based on its current state.
3. Status indicators update in real-time or near real-time to reflect any changes.
4. The new columns do not disrupt existing functionalities or interface layouts.
5. Users can sort and filter bots based on their status.

data.title: [Database migration] Database migration to the StarRocks
data.description:
Since we will `no longer be using the Snowflake warehouse starting in April`, our plan is to migrate everything to `StarRocks`. I have outlined everything that needs to be handled after the DE team migrates data from Snowflake to StarRocks.
I believe there are many scripts, python lib, Airflow DAGs, and other components that are currently being developed or maintained by you guys. Could you create a ticket and spend some time this week `listing all scripts, lib and pipelines`that rely on Snowflake data and need modifications to adapt to the new warehouse?
Additionally, please identify which ones are the highest priority and must be completed within a month. We may need your help updating the scripts accordingly after the DE team has completed the data migration.
Once we complete the data migration and update all DE pipelines and scripts, we will also assist with your pipelines. However, it would be great if we could work in parallel to ensure everything is completed within a month. I really appreciate your support, and I’m confident that by working together, we’ll make this transition smooth and successful. Let’s do this!
`Please choose Data Science Pipeline sheet to fill information`
Thank you for your help! 

ref: [https://www.starrocks.io/](https://www.starrocks.io/)

issues.full_context:
Title: [Database migration] Database migration to the StarRocks

Description:
Since we will `no longer be using the Snowflake warehouse starting in April`, our plan is to migrate everything to `StarRocks`. I have outlined everything that needs to be handled after the DE team migrates data from Snowflake to StarRocks.
I believe there are many scripts, python lib, Airflow DAGs, and other components that are currently being developed or maintained by you guys. Could you create a ticket and spend some time this week `listing all scripts, lib and pipelines`that rely on Snowflake data and need modifications to adapt to the new warehouse?
Additionally, please identify which ones are the highest priority and must be completed within a month. We may need your help updating the scripts accordingly after the DE team has completed the data migration.
Once we complete the data migration and update all DE pipelines and scripts, we will also assist with your pipelines. However, it would be great if we could work in parallel to ensure everything is completed within a month. I really appreciate your support, and I’m confident that by working together, we’ll make this transition smooth and successful. Let’s do this!
`Please choose Data Science Pipeline sheet to fill information`
Thank you for your help! 

ref: [https://www.starrocks.io/](https://www.starrocks.io/)
[https://celerdata.com/blog/trino-vs-starrocks-how-to-get-data-warehouse-performance-on-the-data-lakehouse](https://celerdata.com/blog/trino-vs-starrocks-how-to-get-data-warehouse-performance-on-the-data-lakehouse)

data.title: TM AI Agent - Able to Attain Memory from Other Conversation
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Implement Memory and Continuous Learning System for TM AI Agents (V1 0xTMAI Agents)

**Description:**  
Develop a Memory and Continuous Learning System for the TM AI Agents (V1 0xTMAI Agents) to enable them to retain information from interactions and continuously improve their performance through ongoing learning processes.

**Business Rationale:**  
Enhancing TM AI Agents with memory and continuous learning capabilities will lead to more accurate and personalized user interactions, increase user satisfaction, and ensure the agents can adapt to evolving business requirements. This improvement will strengthen our AI offerings and maintain our competitive edge in the market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The system securely stores and retrieves user interaction data.
2. TM AI Agents show measurable performance improvements based on accumulated memory over multiple sessions.
3. Continuous learning processes are automated, allowing agents to update their knowledge base without manual input.
4. Compliance with all relevant data privacy and security standards is achieved.
5. Successful completion of comprehensive testing to validate the reliability and accuracy of the memory and learning functionalities.

parent.title: TM AI Agent - Memory and Continuous Learning System

data.title: Develop a LLM client for DeepSeek
data.description:
This client will seamlessly replace GPT based LLMs.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Develop a Custom LLM Client to Replace GPT-Based Models for DeepSeek

**Description:**  
Create a proprietary Large Language Model (LLM) client for DeepSeek that seamlessly substitutes the existing GPT-based LLMs. The new client should integrate smoothly with DeepSeek’s infrastructure, ensuring compatibility, reliability, and enhanced performance.

**Business Rationale:**  
Transitioning to a custom LLM client will reduce reliance on third-party GPT providers, decrease operational costs, improve data privacy and security, and allow for greater customization tailored to DeepSeek’s specific requirements. This move will enhance service quality, foster innovation, and maintain a competitive edge in the market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Integration:** The custom LLM client is fully integrated with DeepSeek’s existing systems without disrupting current operations.
2. **Performance:** The new client matches or outperforms GPT-based models in response time, accuracy, and reliability.
3. **User Experience:** End-user interactions remain seamless, with no negative impact during the transition period.
4. **Security & Compliance:** The client meets all data privacy and security standards required by DeepSeek.
5. **Documentation:** Comprehensive documentation and training materials are provided for maintenance and future updates.
6. **Scalability:** The solution supports scalability to handle increased usage and future growth.

data.title: Comparative Analysis of Top Unsloth LLMs for Fine-Tuning Simulated Responses
data.description:
**Description:** Evaluate leading Large Language Models (LLMs) available on Unsloth to simulate responses. Conduct a comparative analysis to determine the feasibility and effectiveness of fine-tuning each model using the KOL dataset to enhance response generation.

**Business Rationale:** Improving response generation capabilities through optimized LLMs will enhance interaction quality, user engagement, and brand reliability, significantly supporting our content and social media strategies.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Identify the top LLMs on Unsloth suitable for response simulation.
* Successfully simulate responses using each selected LLM.
* Assess the feasibility of fine-tuning each model using the KOL dataset.
* Provide a comparative report highlighting performance metrics and recommendations for the most effective models to fine-tune.

data.title: Replace the bitquery with the Privy for fetching the wallet balance
data.description:
**Title:** Replace Bitquery with Privy for Fetching Wallet Balances

**Description:**  
Transition from using Bitquery to Privy for retrieving wallet balances within the V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy/Fiat Gateways. This update aims to improve data accuracy and enhance the efficiency of our data pipelines.

**Business Rationale:**  
Utilizing Privy over Bitquery will provide more reliable and timely wallet balance data, leading to better decision-making by the AI agents. This enhancement is expected to increase system performance and user trust in our trading platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Privy is successfully integrated and configured to fetch wallet balances.
* All instances where Bitquery was previously used are replaced with Privy without functionality loss.
* Data pipelines are built and validated to ensure accurate and consistent data flow.
* Comprehensive testing confirms that wallet balances are correctly retrieved and displayed.
* No existing features are negatively impacted by the replacement.

---

# Step 1: Working with API

✅ Received the [API](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/37313638/2sAYQZGrV6#c5d20f4e-0a90-4211-8059-d7f261505ae0) created 

🚧 However, it encountered the 500 error. and was checking what is going one.

# 🚧 Step 2: Integrated it with the Privy script.

# 🚧 Step 3: Migrate the balance info from the bitquery to the privy.

# 🚧 Step 4: Bridging and mapping the data structure

data.title: [Data Team] Error Handling for Trading Agents
data.description:
**Title:** Error Handling for Trading Agents

**Description:**  
Develop and implement comprehensive error handling for V1 Trading AI Agents interfacing with Privy and Fiat Gateways. This includes the identification, logging, and management of errors to ensure uninterrupted trading operations and system reliability.

**Business Rationale:**  
Robust error handling is essential to maintain the reliability and integrity of trading operations. By effectively managing errors, we can minimize downtime, prevent financial losses, and enhance user trust and satisfaction with our Trading AI Agents.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. All potential error scenarios for Trading AI Agents and gateway interactions are identified and documented.
2. The system captures and logs errors with detailed information for troubleshooting.
3. The Trading AI Agents gracefully handle errors without crashing or entering inconsistent states.
4. Users receive clear and actionable notifications when errors impact their interactions.
5. Automated alerting mechanisms are in place for critical errors to ensure timely resolution.

data.title: own note
data.description:
warehouse type in snowflake: [https://select.dev/posts/snowflake-warehouse-sizing](https://select.dev/posts/snowflake-warehouse-sizing)

different sql syntax between snowflake and other warehouse like clickhouse: ETA for transpiling all sql scripts!!!

* important: DS team need to check whether clickhouse support all feature, sql function that they need before we decide to migrate
* grafana free support getting data directly from clickhouse (we can move all snowflake dashboard to grafana)
* in snowflake: we manage resource by creating virtual warehouse, in snowflake we share all workload in the same mem/cpu
* be careful with ID (Primary logic). in coingecko_tokens, the auto increment feature in snowflake is very important
* clickhouse doesn't support `merge` we might need to re-write many sql queries
* Clickhouse supports limited window functions compared to Snowflake (need to involve DS team to evaluate)
  * [https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/functions-window](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/functions-window)
  * [https://clickhouse.com/docs/en/sql-reference/functions/time-window-functions](https://clickhouse.com/docs/en/sql-reference/functions/time-window-functions)
* Clickhouse and Starock:
  * If we go with clickhouse: we need to slowly make flat tables as many as possible. because join in clickhouse is very slow. ([https://celerdata.com/blog/clickhouse-vs.-starrocks-a-detailed-comparison](https://celerdata.com/blog/clickhouse-vs.-starrocks-a-detailed-comparison))

In Snowflake:

Storage: 23TB

Warehouse:  3 active warehouse (mostly 2)

[https://select.dev/posts/snowflake-warehouse-sizing](https://select.dev/posts/snowflake-warehouse-sizing)

X-Small: 8 core, 16GB Ram

I assume we use all 3 warehouse 24/24 perday.

\-> in total: 24 core, 48GB Ram 

cost: 9131 - 11.217 USD

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/8ed12c37-65a4-48ca-9114-e7611bfbb00d/cc01193a-13b4-4927-9d0b-26c3a39d67e0)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/032a001e-3b17-4590-be10-a8c11f4310aa/cbc29e13-1ad4-41a3-9adb-b14c65eefd1a)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/2e5cbe89-5392-45f6-83b6-202d5dddf762/fdf76f74-5559-4749-8918-a9edb1b8daf2)

In clickhouse: 

[https://clickhouse.com/pricing?provider=gcp&region=us-central1&hours=24&storageUnit=tb&storageSize=23&storageCompressed=no&computeMaxSize=96](https://clickhouse.com/pricing?provider=gcp&region=us-central1&hours=24&storageUnit=tb&storageSize=23&storageCompressed=no&computeMaxSize=96)

96GB ram, 24CPU: 

23 TB

cost 516 - 1781$

Or with 192GB ram, 48CPU:

[https://clickhouse.com/pricing?provider=gcp&region=us-central1&hours=24&storageUnit=tb&storageSize=23&storageCompressed=no&computeMaxSize=192](https://clickhouse.com/pricing?provider=gcp&region=us-central1&hours=24&storageUnit=tb&storageSize=23&storageCompressed=no&computeMaxSize=192)

It cost: **$516 - $3,468**

Also. Clickhouse allow us to automatically scale cpu and ram depending on the workload.

data.title: Resolve Kafka Deployment Issues on Digital Oceans
data.description:
Hi @divine / @peterson, please help me fixing Kafka so I can continue migrating application from GCP to DO.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve Kafka Deployment Issues on Digital Ocean

**Description:**

**Description:** Address and fix the current Kafka deployment problems on Digital Ocean to enable the seamless migration of the application from Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to Digital Ocean (DO).

**Business Rationale:** Migrating to Digital Ocean is aimed at optimizing infrastructure costs and enhancing performance. Ensuring Kafka operates smoothly on DO is critical for maintaining reliable messaging services and the overall functionality of the migrated application.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Kafka is successfully deployed and operational on Digital Ocean.
2. All necessary configurations are correctly set up and validated.
3. The application migration from GCP to DO proceeds without Kafka-related disruptions.
4. Monitoring and logging for Kafka on DO are implemented and functioning as expected.
5. Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the new Kafka deployment on Digital Ocean.

**Title:** Resolve Kafka Deployment Issues on Digital Ocean

**Description:**

**Description:** Address and fix the current Kafka deployment problems on Digital Ocean to enable the seamless migration of the application from Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to Digital Ocean (DO).

**Business Rationale:** Migrating to Digital Ocean is aimed at optimizing infrastructure costs and enhancing performance. Ensuring Kafka operates smoothly on DO is critical for maintaining reliable messaging services and the overall functionality of the migrated application.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Kafka is successfully deployed and operational on Digital Ocean.
2. All necessary configurations are correctly set up and validated.
3. The application migration from GCP to DO proceeds without Kafka-related disruptions.
4. Monitoring and logging for Kafka on DO are implemented and functioning as expected.
5. Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the new Kafka deployment on Digital Ocean.

data.title: Create Daily OHLCV Endpoint
data.description:
Create a new endpoint that returns daily ohlcv data. This will allow users to pick query faster historical prices, without the requirement to resample hourly to daily.

Endpoint Name : **Daily OHLCV**

Filters : same as Hourly OHLCV endpoint

Example Query (in Starrocks):

```
SELECT TOKEN_ID, CG_ID, DATE, OPEN, HIGH, LOW, CLOSE, VOLUME
FROM COINGECKO.COINGECKO_OHLCV_AGGREGATION_VIEW
WHERE TOKEN_ID = 3375 LIMIT 10;
```

**Title:** Deploy Data API to Digital Ocean App Platform

**Description:**  
Migrate the Token Metrics Data API to the Digital Ocean App Platform to utilize its scalable infrastructure and efficient deployment capabilities. Ensure seamless integration with existing systems and maintain full functionality during and after the transition.

**Business Rationale:**  
Deploying the Data API on Digital Ocean will enhance scalability, improve performance, and reduce infrastructure management overhead. This move supports faster feature releases, ensures higher reliability, and provides a robust platform to accommodate growing user demands.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The Data API is successfully deployed on the Digital Ocean App Platform.
* All API endpoints are fully functional and perform as expected.
* Integration with existing services and databases is seamless with no disruptions.
* Deployment process is automated and documented.
* Performance metrics meet or exceed current benchmarks post-deployment.
* Comprehensive testing is completed with no critical issues outstanding.

data.title: Update Hourly OHLCV Endpoint with Optimized Query & Enforce Date Filters
data.description:
**Description:**

* Update the hourly OHLCV endpoint using the optimized query provided by Anki.
* Deploy the changes to production.
* Handle the filter change, as the new updated view only allows fetching data for the last 30 days.
* Make `startDate` and `endDate` mandatory parameters.
* Update the developer documentation to reflect these changes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The endpoint uses the optimized query.
* The data fetch is restricted to the last 30 days.
* Requests without `startDate` and `endDate` should return an error.
* The updated changes are deployed to production.
* Developer documentation is updated accordingly.

comments.body:
**Action Items Taken:**

* Optimized the query logic for retrieving hourly OHLCV data by using the `anki_optimized` view.
* Added mandatory start and end date parameters, ensuring the start date cannot be older than 30 days.
* Tested locally, achieving a response time of \~406ms once cached.
* Deployed the update to production.
* Updated developer documentation to reflect changes in filter requirements.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/2cee5a21-9c1b-4414-89f9-3b0a78b734fa](https://jam.dev/c/2cee5a21-9c1b-4414-89f9-3b0a78b734fa)
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6903). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: [Group] - Indices Platform Testing 13
data.description:
## **Title1:** Tooltip Placement Incorrect Next to Index Percentage in Investor and Trader Index

**Description:**
In both the **Investor** and **Trader Index**, the **tooltip** is not placed correctly next to the **index percentage**. The tooltip should be positioned directly adjacent to the percentage value

[https://jam.dev/c/64d8a9dd-9426-42e2-961a-df4c874fc770](https://jam.dev/c/64d8a9dd-9426-42e2-961a-df4c874fc770)

## **Title2:** Missing "Index Rebalances After Each Week" Text and Tooltip Under "Buy Index" Button

**Description:**
The text **"Index rebalances after each week"** and its corresponding **tooltip** are missing under the **"Buy Index"** button, which are present in the **Figma design**. These elements are important for informing users about the rebalancing schedule of the index, and their absence causes inconsistency with the design.

[https://jam.dev/c/b8777b8d-9fe8-4d31-a274-6ba52a9d67e2](https://jam.dev/c/b8777b8d-9fe8-4d31-a274-6ba52a9d67e2)

## **Title3:** "My Indices" Tab Missing in Current UI

**Description:**
The **"My Indices"** tab is missing in the current **UI**, even though it is specified in the design. This causes a gap in the user experience, as users are unable to access their personal indices

## **Title4:** "Buy Index" Popup and "Select Token" Section Not Fully Visible in Mobile View

**Description:**
In the **mobile view**, the **"Buy Index"** popup and the **"Select Token"** section are not fully visible and are extending outside the screen boundaries. This issue causes the user interface to be cut off and affects the overall user experience, as users cannot see or interact with the full content.

[https://jam.dev/c/7973c9b8-96e2-4bd0-a0c7-d1dd7f5f8e44](https://jam.dev/c/7973c9b8-96e2-4bd0-a0c7-d1dd7f5f8e44)

## **Title5:** "Connect Wallet" Button Not Working in "Buy Index" Popup

**Description:**
The **"Connect Wallet"** button in the **"Buy Index"** popup is not functioning as expected. When clicked, nothing happens, and the wallet is not connected, preventing users from completing the **Buy Index** process. This issue disrupts the user's ability to interact with the platform properly.

[https://jam.dev/c/f2c5ba2b-72d1-4851-a00d-7c6e10fcbbb7](https://jam.dev/c/f2c5ba2b-72d1-4851-a00d-7c6e10fcbbb7)

## **Title6:** Missing Token  Price Field in "Invest" Section of "Buy Index" Popup

**Description:**
In the **"Buy Index"** popup, the **"Invest"** section is missing the field that should display the corresponding **dollar price** for the selected token. This field is essential for users to see the price of the token in dollars before proceeding with the transaction.

[https://jam.dev/c/941c8bf0-5fcc-452b-8f75-9c37530adce3](https://jam.dev/c/941c8bf0-5fcc-452b-8f75-9c37530adce3)

## **Title7:** "Buy Index" Text Should Be Specific to the Index (e.g., "Buy Meme Index")

**Description:**
In the **"Buy Index"** section, the text currently reads as **"Buy Index"**, but it should dynamically display the specific name of the index . For example, when a user is on the **Meme Index** page, the text should **"Buy Meme Index"** as shown in the **Figma design**. [https://jam.dev/c/30c4f080-03aa-4320-a508-9e6d02aba698](https://jam.dev/c/30c4f080-03aa-4320-a508-9e6d02aba698) @ben please clarify it.

data.title: Migrate fetch staking history query to prisma
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Migrate Fetch Staking History Query to Prisma

**Description:**
Refactor the current staking history retrieval process to utilize Prisma ORM, enhancing code maintainability and performance within the Governance and Staking Platform.

**Business Rationale:**
Transitioning to Prisma will reduce technical debt, streamline database operations, and improve scalability. This migration supports more efficient development and ensures reliable access to staking data, ultimately enhancing the user experience and platform stability.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The staking history query is successfully implemented using Prisma.
* Existing staking history functionalities operate without regressions.
* Query performance is equal to or better than the previous implementation.
* Comprehensive tests (unit and integration) are updated and pass successfully.
* Code review is completed and approved by the development team.

data.title: [Group] - Burn-to-Stake Platform Testing 2
data.description:
## **Title1:** "Initiating Transaction" State Stuck After Rejecting Transaction Request

**Description:**
When a user rejects a **Transaction Request**, the state remains stuck in **"Initiating Transaction"**, preventing the user from proceeding further. 

[https://jam.dev/c/9c53d702-e8f3-48ef-a2af-211638ed0b02](https://jam.dev/c/9c53d702-e8f3-48ef-a2af-211638ed0b02)

## Title2: Footer Alignment Issue – Staking, Governance, and Launchpad Should Be Stacked, Not Side-by-Side

**Description:**
In the **footer** section, the **Staking**, **Governance**, and **Launchpad** elements are currently displayed **side-by-side**. However, according to the **Figma design**, these elements should be stacked vertically (one under the other) for better alignment and consistency with the design.

[https://jam.dev/c/23f6b919-d252-4027-8973-54afee4f9ce4](https://jam.dev/c/23f6b919-d252-4027-8973-54afee4f9ce4)

## **Title3:**  Unable to Change Network

**Description:**
The application is not allowing users to **change the network**. When attempting to switch between networks (e.g., switching from **Base**), the change does not take effect, preventing users from selecting and interacting with tokens from different networks.

[https://jam.dev/c/948ec627-8358-41c2-a315-ac256f4a1e0a](https://jam.dev/c/948ec627-8358-41c2-a315-ac256f4a1e0a)

## **Title4:** "Your Astrobot NFTs" Search and Price Sort Features Not Working

**Description:**
In the **"Your Astrobot NFTs"** section, the **search** and **price sort** features are not functioning as expected. The search bar does not return any results, and the price sort option does not reorder the NFTs by price. This affects the usability of the section, as users are unable to search or sort their NFTs based on price.

[https://jam.dev/c/74fa9e9f-90f5-4c9d-8ebd-247866d99b2b](https://jam.dev/c/74fa9e9f-90f5-4c9d-8ebd-247866d99b2b)

## **Title5:** Astro Logo Colors Do Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The colors of the **Astro Logo** do not match the colors specified in the **Figma design**.

[https://jam.dev/c/4b3b1243-356b-4ca7-8243-81a7220e5d83](https://jam.dev/c/4b3b1243-356b-4ca7-8243-81a7220e5d83)

## **Title6:** "Confirm Burn & Stake" Popup Button Alignment Issue

**Description:**
In the **"Confirm Burn & Stake"** popup, the **Burn & Stake button** is not aligned properly on the left side. It should be aligned in the same horizontal position as the **Burn & Stake** button in the **Figma design** for visual consistency.

[https://jam.dev/c/030f8f38-1005-4e45-97a9-ac4d3b5e56f4](https://jam.dev/c/030f8f38-1005-4e45-97a9-ac4d3b5e56f4)

## **Title7:** Missing Pagination in "Your Astrobot NFTs" Section

**Description:**
In the **"Your Astrobot NFTs"** section, the **pagination** functionality is missing. This prevents users from navigating through multiple pages of NFTs when there are more than one page of results, causing usability issues when the collection grows larger.

## **Title8:** Mobile View - Menu Does Not Close After Clicking Staking, Governance, BurnStake, Launchpad Tabs

**Description:**
In the **mobile view**, when clicking on the **Staking**, **Governance**, **BurnStake**, or **Launchpad** tabs, the menu does not close automatically, which causes the UI to remain cluttered and affects the navigation experience. The menu should close after clicking on these tabs, as per standard mobile navigation behavior.

[https://jam.dev/c/b1a65d8d-66df-41da-9bd8-b31152ff68e0](https://jam.dev/c/b1a65d8d-66df-41da-9bd8-b31152ff68e0)

## **Title9:** "Confirm Burn & Stake" Popup in Mobile View Does Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
In the **mobile view**, the **"Confirm Burn & Stake"** popup does not match the layout and styling as specified in the **Figma design**. The popup's appearance, including element positioning and spacing, is inconsistent with the design, which affects the overall user experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/9eb8c1ef-ba5d-4b53-b3c4-eca683170a9d](https://jam.dev/c/9eb8c1ef-ba5d-4b53-b3c4-eca683170a9d)

## **Title10:** Unnecessary Line in Title of "Confirm Burn & Stake" Popup

**Description:**
In the **"Confirm Burn & Stake"** popup, there is an **unnecessary line** appearing in the title section. This line is not present in the **Figma design** 

[https://jam.dev/c/1cda0e5e-a537-426d-8742-a94b65ba5911](https://jam.dev/c/1cda0e5e-a537-426d-8742-a94b65ba5911)

## **Title11:** Issues in "Burn In Progress" Popup

**Description:**
The **"Burn In Progress"** popup has multiple issues affecting the user interface and design. These issues include incorrect label placements, visual discrepancies in checkboxes, and styling differences in the ticked circles.

### **Issue 1: Label Placement in From and To Fields**

* **From** field: The label should show **"Base Sepolia"** directly across from the input field.
* **To** field: The label should show **"Ethereum"** directly across from the input field.
* Currently, these labels are displayed in the lower section of the popup. Please check figma

### **Issue 2: Tick Boxes in the Popup**

* The tick boxes (the round circles with a checkmark) should be **empty** and **not grey**. Please check figma.

### **Issue 3: Styling of the Tick Boxes**

* The **tick mark** circles are shown larger than expected and **not in dark green** as per the **Figma design**. Please check figma

[https://jam.dev/c/10d2c7ed-6054-4db7-9e8d-d4a967c817a0](https://jam.dev/c/10d2c7ed-6054-4db7-9e8d-d4a967c817a0)

## **Title12:** Unable to Reopen "Burn In Progress" Popup After Clicking Outside

**Description:**
When clicking outside the **"Burn In Progress"** popup, the popup closes, but after that, it cannot be reopened while in progress. This issue prevents the user from interacting with the popup again, which may be a hindrance to completing the desired action.

[https://jam.dev/c/e8bef661-c52b-46bb-a88c-e0521b0bcf34](https://jam.dev/c/e8bef661-c52b-46bb-a88c-e0521b0bcf34)

data.title: Burn To Stake Axelar Pay Gas Fee Integration within TokenMetrics Website for improved UX
data.description:
* Cutting the dependecy for users to get on to axelar site and pay gas manually there
* Every Transaction and it's live tracking happens at Token Metrics dashboard itself
* Impact : Improved UX

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Integrate Axelar Pay Gas Fee within TokenMetrics for Enhanced User Experience

**Description:**  
Implement the ability for users to pay gas fees directly on the TokenMetrics website by integrating Axelar Pay. This will eliminate the need for users to navigate to the Axelar site to manually pay gas fees. Additionally, ensure that all transactions and their live tracking are accessible within the TokenMetrics dashboard.

**Business Rationale:**  
Streamlining the gas fee payment process within TokenMetrics enhances the overall user experience, reducing friction and dependency on external platforms. This improvement is expected to increase user satisfaction, retention, and engagement by providing a seamless and efficient transaction workflow.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Users can pay gas fees directly on the TokenMetrics website without being redirected to the Axelar site.
2. All transactions initiated through TokenMetrics are tracked and displayed in real-time on the dashboard.
3. The integration maintains or improves the website’s performance and reliability.
4. User feedback indicates a noticeable improvement in the transaction process and overall UX.

comments.body: It takes 15-16 minutes to achieve finality on Ethereum - [https://docs.axelar.dev/learn/txduration/#casper-friendly-finality-gadget-eg-eth-pos](https://docs.axelar.dev/learn/txduration/#casper-friendly-finality-gadget-eg-eth-pos)

We are doing the same, sending the NFT to the dead address (on Ethereum) and airdropping staked veTMAI for 12 months(on Base).

However, since the Astrobot NFTs are on `Ethereum` and TMAI is on `Base`, we need to pass a cross-chain message from `Ethereum` to `Base` using Axelar and have to wait for the finality to achieve so that the transaction doesn't get orphaned.(the case where users gets to keep both, Astrobot NFT and staked veTMAI). 

That said, as soon as the finality is achieved, users immediately get their staked veTMAI, and it doesn't even take a full second after finality.

Reference JAM : [https://jam.dev/c/11010701-e8ac-47d9-a2cc-43de626bc2f0](https://jam.dev/c/11010701-e8ac-47d9-a2cc-43de626bc2f0)

@ben @ian Please have a look and let me know for any feedback
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6892). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: [DATA API] Hourly OHLCV endpoint
data.description:
We need to optimize this query being used to retrieve data for hourly ohlcv
For endpoint filters you can see here [https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/reference/hourly-ohlcv](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/reference/hourly-ohlcv)
Current query 

```
SELECT 
  CAST ("TOKEN_ID" as INT) as "TOKEN_ID", 
  "TOKEN_NAME", 
  "TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
  "TIMESTAMP", 
  "OPEN", 
  "HIGH", 
  "LOW", 
  "CLOSE", 
  "VOLUME" 
FROM 
  COINGECKO.COINGECKO_HOURLY_OHLCV_VIEW 
WHERE 
  (
    "TOKEN_ID" IN ('3375', '3306') 
    OR LOWER("TOKEN_SYMBOL") IN ('btc', 'eth') 
    OR LOWER("TOKEN_NAME") IN ('bitcoin', 'ethereum')
  ) 
  AND "TIMESTAMP" >= '2025-02-13' 
  AND "TIMESTAMP" <= '2025-02-14' 
ORDER BY 
  "TIMESTAMP" DESC 
LIMIT 
  10 OFFSET 0
```

where token_id, timestamp, symbol and name is dynamic values coming from api filters

comments.body:
@harshg please check, 
replace **or -> end**
if user don't request **startDate or endDate -> throw error

Api rules:
startDate or endDate** will based on latest 30days
**limit:** max 100 (reduce from 1000)
**token_id, symbol, token_name: max 10 each fields** 

```
explain SELECT
CAST ("TOKEN_ID" as INT) as "TOKEN_ID", 
  "TOKEN_NAME", 
  "TOKEN_SYMBOL", 
  "CREATED_AT" as "TIMESTAMP",
  "OPEN", 
  "HIGH", 
  "LOW", 
  "CLOSE", 
  "VOLUME" 
  FROM 
  coingecko.coingecko_ohlcv_data 
WHERE 
  "TOKEN_ID" IN ('3375', '3306') 
  and LOWER("TOKEN_SYMBOL") IN ('btc', 'eth') 
  and LOWER("TOKEN_NAME") IN ('bitcoin', 'ethereum') 
  AND "CREATED_AT" >= '2025-02-13' 
  AND "CREATED_AT" <= '2025-02-14' 
ORDER BY 
  "CREATED_AT" DESC 
```

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/0961153f-fe6b-4a8c-9827-f98bca070950/73877ebf-8687-4ec9-b69b-e17cc65a1a45)

data.title: Restrict Access to Market Chart Endpoints for Common Users
data.description:
**Description:**
As per the decision [here](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/archives/C07F3SD76EA/p1742585062137109?thread_ts=1742566083.172799&cid=C07F3SD76EA), market chart endpoints should no longer be accessible to common users, as they are not central to general usage.

### **Requirements:**

* Remove public access to market chart endpoints.
* Ensure these endpoints remain accessible internally for automation tools like Zapier.
* No impact on existing internal workflows.

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Market chart endpoints are blocked for common users.
* Internal tools and automations retain access.
* No unintended impact on other API functionalities.

comments.body:
**Action items taken:**

* Removed access for common users.
* Ensured that graph endpoints remain accessible for internal automation use, such as Zapier.
* Tested the functionality after deployment.
* Removed the chart endpoint documentation from the developer docs.

issues.full_context:
Title: Restrict Access to Market Chart Endpoints for Common Users

Description:
**Description:**
As per the decision [here](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/archives/C07F3SD76EA/p1742585062137109?thread_ts=1742566083.172799&cid=C07F3SD76EA), market chart endpoints should no longer be accessible to common users, as they are not central to general usage.

### **Requirements:**

* Remove public access to market chart endpoints.
* Ensure these endpoints remain accessible internally for automation tools like Zapier.
* No impact on existing internal workflows.

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Market chart endpoints are blocked for common users.
* Internal tools and automations retain access.
* No unintended impact on other API functionalities.

data.title: Add Custom Rate Limiting to Data API
data.description:
**Description:**
We need to implement a custom rate-limiting system for the Data API to control request caps and provide API access to users integrating with our system.

### **Requirements:**

* Allow creation of custom API keys with defined request limits (e.g., 50K requests).
* Ensure that the API key becomes inactive once the limit is reached.
* Maintain a way to track usage per key and enforce the cap in real-time.
* Ensure the original code remains unaffected.
* Prod deployment to after testing and verifying functionality on dev env

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Admins should be able to generate API keys with a custom request cap.
* Users should receive a clear response when their limit is reached.
* No impact on existing API functionality.

comments.body:
### **Action Items Taken:**

* Created logic for custom rate limiting, allowing us to specify API keys and set request caps.
* Synced with Jake to create new tables for storing these custom keys (using Supabase tables, as the Data API is fully running on Supabase in production).
* Ensured the implementation does not interfere with the original flow.
* Tested the functionality locally.
* Deployed to production.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/9f08516b-6b6c-4124-8ee7-0aafc884daec](https://jam.dev/c/9f08516b-6b6c-4124-8ee7-0aafc884daec)

### **Next Steps:**

* I will generate the custom API keys and cap them at 50K requests.
* I will share the keys in dedicated Telegram groups so they can be unblocked for testing and begin building integrations with our API (Heurist, FlowX, and Laika AI)
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6889). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Alert Notifications Not Triggering Properly
data.description:
A user has reported issues with their alert notifications. Their most recent successful alert was on **March 12, 2025**, but since then, several bullish-switched **tokens** have not triggered an alert.

They provided an example: **Heroes of Mavia**, for which they did not receive an alert. All alerts are set up identically, so the issue is not on their end.

Additionally, **text alerts are not being received**—only email alerts are working. This suggests a potential system-wide issue that may be affecting other users.

Email - [christopher_devore@hotmail.com](mailto:christopher_devore@hotmail.com)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/92dc065e-3fe1-402c-b147-dcc62b0df769/ebdb2831-a9c2-48ad-bbd3-2e7431a55e66)

#### **Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Check the user's alert settings and logs to confirm the issue.
2. Investigate why bullish token alerts are not triggering.
3. Verify if text alerts are failing for all users.
4. Cross-check with user groups to see if others are experiencing the same problem.

#### **Attachments:**

* User will provide the **Heroes of Mavia alert setup** for reference.

#### **Expected Outcome:**

* Alerts should trigger correctly for all relevant tokens.
* Text alerts should be functional alongside email alerts.
* Confirm if the issue is isolated or affecting multiple users.

comments.body: @suleman please add me to the call to go over
they were working when I tested them. I will take a look again on all alerts with @ozcan.

Thanks for flagging this. @suleman @ozcan can you confirm if the notification options were fully functional during your testing.
I believe the in-app notifications are not setup for token alerts

@suleman @ozcan where all of these notification options working for both of you when you tested this tickets?

This is the 

[ENG-4426](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-4426/ensure-in-app-notifications-are-enabled-and-functioning-properly)
[ENG-2971](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-2971/implement-notifications-tab)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/7e3ea2f2-cf6f-4f43-a844-0d8f78116a02/2277e6ae-fe9c-482b-a1a6-925d0c86ef52)

This is the third most requested feature by our users, so we need to resolve this for good.

cc: @sam @ayo 

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/6bdf54ed-a46b-4051-8969-1b5e9679a2c0/ca1233e2-6639-44c2-a713-eeae5f51fd64)

data.title: [Trading Agent] Refactor Trading Agent List/Details View
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** \[Trading Agent\] Refactor Trading Agent List/Details View

**Description:**  
Optimize the structure and functionality of the Trading Agent List and Details views to improve performance, maintainability, and user experience in alignment with the Supabase Integration and the deployment of V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways.

**Business Rationale:**  
Refactoring these views is crucial to ensure seamless integration with Supabase, enhance system scalability for future AI trading features, and provide users with a more efficient and intuitive interface for managing trading agents and their gateways.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The List and Details views are restructured following best coding practices.
* Loading times and responsiveness are significantly improved.
* Successful integration with the Supabase backend.
* Compatibility with V1 Trading AI Agents and Privy/Fiat Gateways is ensured.
* All existing functionalities remain intact and pass regression testing.
* Code is reviewed and approved by the development team.

data.title: Optimize Queries for Trader, Investor, and Index-Specific Holdings Data
data.description:
**Description:**
While migrating to Supabase, the original query took too long to execute. Ankit optimized the query, which we can now use to fetch trader, investor, and index-specific holdings data more efficiently.

**Tasks:**

* Replace existing queries with the optimized ones.
* Ensure Supabase tables are used correctly.
* Refactor the data-fetching logic to align with the new query structure.
* Adjust the frontend to accommodate the changes, including restructuring pagination if needed.
* Test thoroughly to ensure compatibility and performance improvements.

comments.body:
### **Action Items Taken:**

* Connected with Anki to review the optimized query.
* Since the optimized query works a bit differently, had to update the backend and frontend logic to properly display the index holdings data along with pagination.
* After implementation, encountered some issues with the query, requiring another sync with Anki to address them.
* Once the queries were migrated, tested everything on the frontend.
* With this ticket, the Supabase migration of AI indices is now 100% complete.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/c4f2a37a-48d3-42d2-8806-d285b00461e8](https://jam.dev/c/c4f2a37a-48d3-42d2-8806-d285b00461e8)

data.title: Test Data API so we can send to Unguess
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Develop Test Data API for Integration with Unguess

**Description:**
Create a Test Data API that enables the secure and efficient transmission of test data to Unguess, facilitating seamless integration and collaboration between our systems.

**Business Rationale:**
Integrating with Unguess requires reliable data exchange to ensure accurate testing and validation of functionalities. Developing this API will streamline the integration process, enhance data consistency, and support timely project milestones, ultimately improving overall product quality and partnership effectiveness.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* API securely transmits test data to Unguess without errors.
* Comprehensive documentation is provided, including endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication mechanisms.
* Successful data transmission is verified through testing with predefined sample data.
* API is deployed to the designated environment and is accessible to relevant stakeholders.
* Logging and error handling are implemented to monitor API performance and issues.

data.title: Portfolio QA & Testing
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

---

**Title:** Implement Test Portfolio Feature

**Description:**

**Description:**  
Develop a Test Portfolio functionality that allows users to create, manage, and simulate investment portfolios within the application.

**Business Rationale:**  
Introducing a Test Portfolio feature enables users to experiment with different asset allocations and investment strategies without financial risk. This enhances user engagement, provides educational value, and can lead to increased user retention and attraction of new users interested in portfolio management tools.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Creation:** Users can create a new Test Portfolio by providing a unique name and optional description.
2. **Management:** Users can add, edit, and remove assets within their Test Portfolio.
3. **Simulation:** Users can simulate portfolio performance based on historical data and view projected outcomes.
4. **Accessibility:** Test Portfolios are accessible from the user dashboard and can be viewed on all supported devices.
5. **Validation:** The system validates user inputs and displays appropriate error messages for invalid data.
6. **Persistence:** Test Portfolios are saved and persist across user sessions.

---

data.title: Check Logs to investigate this
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve Platform Login Failures and Page Refresh Loops

**Description:** Investigate and fix the issues preventing users from logging in and causing pages to continuously refresh. Analyze system logs to identify the root causes and implement necessary solutions to restore stable login functionality.

**Business Rationale:** Ensuring reliable user access is critical for maintaining user satisfaction, preventing churn, and sustaining revenue. Addressing these login issues will enhance the user experience and uphold platform credibility.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Root causes of login failures and page refresh loops are identified through log analysis.
* Implemented fixes successfully allow users to log in without encountering page refresh issues.
* Comprehensive testing confirms the resolution across all affected user scenarios.
* No new related issues are introduced post-deployment.
* Confirmation from QA that the platform operates as expected.

data.description:

**Private Launchpad Smart Contract Review and Integration**

**Description:**
Perform a thorough review and analysis of the Private Launchpad smart contract to ensure its security and functionality, followed by its seamless integration into the platform.

**Business Rationale:**
Ensuring the Private Launchpad smart contract is secure and properly integrated is crucial for providing a reliable launch platform. This will enhance user trust, facilitate successful token launches, and support the platform’s growth and reputation.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Comprehensive review of the smart contract code is completed with no critical vulnerabilities identified.
* All identified issues from the review are addressed and resolved.
* Smart contract is successfully deployed in the testing environment without errors.
* Integration with the platform is completed without disrupting existing functionalities.
* Full functionality of the launchpad is verified through thorough testing.
* Documentation for the review and integration process is completed and approved.

data.title: Private Launchpad Smart Contract Integration
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Private Launchpad Smart Contract Integration

**Description:**
Integrate a secure and efficient smart contract into the Private Launchpad platform to facilitate token sales, manage participant interactions, and ensure automated and transparent transactions.

**Business Rationale:**
Implementing a smart contract will enhance the transparency and security of the token sale process, build trust with participants, automate transactions, and reduce reliance on manual interventions. This integration will improve overall platform efficiency, user experience, and scalability, positioning the Private Launchpad competitively in the market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Smart contract is developed following industry best security practices and successfully audited.
* Deployment of the smart contract on the designated blockchain network is completed without issues.
* Seamless integration with the Private Launchpad platform, allowing users to participate in token sales through the smart contract.
* Automated tracking and management of token allocations and participant contributions.
* Comprehensive testing is conducted to ensure all functionalities operate as intended without bugs.
* Detailed documentation is provided, outlining the smart contract’s functionalities and the integration process.

Implementing a smart contract will enhance the transparency and security of the token sale process, build trust with participants, automate transactions, and reduce reliance on manual interventions. This integration will improve overall platform efficiency, user experience, and scalability, positioning the Private Launchpad competitively in the market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Smart contract is developed following industry best security practices and successfully audited.
* Deployment of the smart contract on the designated blockchain network is completed without issues.
* Seamless integration with the Private Launchpad platform, allowing users to participate in token sales through the smart contract.
* Automated tracking and management of token allocations and participant contributions.
* Comprehensive testing is conducted to ensure all functionalities operate as intended without bugs.
* Detailed documentation is provided, outlining the smart contract’s functionalities and the integration process.

data.description:

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Investigate and Resolve Production Error in Logs

**Description:**
A recurring error has been detected in the production environment logs, which may be affecting system performance and user experience. This issue requires a thorough investigation to identify the root cause and implement an appropriate fix to ensure system stability.

**Business Rationale:**
Addressing this error is essential to maintain the reliability of our application, prevent potential downtime, and uphold a high-quality user experience, thereby supporting customer satisfaction and retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The root cause of the production error is identified and documented.
* A fix is developed, tested in a staging environment, and successfully deployed to production.
* Monitoring is set up to ensure the error does not reoccur.
* Verification that the error no longer appears in production logs after deployment.

data.title: [Custom Node Taints Persistence] Preserve Custom Node Taints on Node Replacement/Upgrades
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Preserve Custom Node Taints During Node Replacement and Upgrades

**Description:**
Ensure that any custom taints applied to nodes are maintained when nodes undergo replacement or upgrades. This preservation is essential to maintain consistent workload scheduling and cluster behavior.

**Business Rationale:**
Retaining custom node taints during maintenance operations prevents unintended disruptions in workload placement and ensures that application requirements and policies remain enforced. This reliability is crucial for maintaining service quality and operational stability in production environments.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Custom taints on nodes are not removed or altered during node replacement.
2. Custom taints persist through all node upgrade processes.
3. Automated tests verify the persistence of custom taints after replacement and upgrade operations.
4. Documentation reflects the behavior of taint preservation during node lifecycle events.
