data.title: [Pod Ownership Enforcement] Ensure Pods Referencing DOBS Volumes are Owned by StatefulSet
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enforce StatefulSet Ownership for Pods Using DOBS Volumes

**Description:** Ensure that all Kubernetes Pods referencing Digital Ocean Block Storage (DOBS) volumes are managed by a StatefulSet. This guarantees consistent pod management and reliable handling of persistent storage.

**Business Rationale:** Managing Pods through StatefulSets provides stable identities and persistent storage, which enhances application reliability and simplifies production readiness on Digital Ocean. This enforcement reduces potential downtime and streamlines maintenance processes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All Pods utilizing DOBS volumes are verified to be owned by a StatefulSet.
* Any Pods not currently managed by a StatefulSet are reconfigured accordingly.
* Successful completion of production readiness checks on Digital Ocean without volume ownership issues.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enforce StatefulSet Ownership for Pods Using DOBS Volumes

**Description:** Ensure that all Kubernetes Pods referencing Digital Ocean Block Storage (DOBS) volumes are managed by a StatefulSet. This guarantees consistent pod management and reliable handling of persistent storage.

**Business Rationale:** Managing Pods through StatefulSets provides stable identities and persistent storage, which enhances application reliability and simplifies production readiness on Digital Ocean. This enforcement reduces potential downtime and streamlines maintenance processes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All Pods utilizing DOBS volumes are verified to be owned by a StatefulSet.
* Any Pods not currently managed by a StatefulSet are reconfigured accordingly.
* Successful completion of production readiness checks on Digital Ocean without volume ownership issues.

data.title: Add Alerts to Digital Ocean Cluster to monitor Infra
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Alerts for Monitoring Infrastructure on Digital Ocean Cluster

**Description:**
Set up and configure alerting systems within the Digital Ocean cluster to monitor key infrastructure metrics. This will enable real-time detection of issues and ensure the stability and performance of the infrastructure.

**Business Rationale:**
Proactive monitoring through alerts helps in identifying and addressing infrastructure problems promptly, reducing downtime, and maintaining optimal performance. This ensures a reliable service for users and minimizes potential revenue loss due to outages or performance degradation.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Alerts are configured for critical metrics including CPU usage, memory usage, disk space, and network latency.
* Notification channels (e.g., email, Slack) are integrated and tested for receiving alerts.
* Alerts are tested to confirm they trigger under predefined threshold conditions.
* Documentation is provided detailing the alert configurations and response procedures.
* Monitoring dashboards display real-time data and active alerts accurately.

This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6844). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Production Deployment of DATA API using Supabase
data.description:
**Description:**
Deploy the **DATA API** to production using the Supabase table. This includes:

* Deploying the **dashboard** and **API endpoints** in sync.
* Coordinating with **Divine** for any DevOps-related tasks.
* Ensuring smooth deployment with minimal downtime.
* Validating the deployment post-release.

comments.body:
@ian It's decent for now, we have data loading 20% faster, but we can improve it further with caching and query optimizations. I'm working with Anki on optimizing certain queries.

Right now, we're prioritizing Stake-to-Access, but after that, we need to focus on various Data API improvements identified by Suleman. This will help us bring each endpoint to a 1-second or lower response time
@harshg great work! What's the performance improvement after switching from Snowflake to Supabase?

Action items taken:

* Deployed the dashboard from TM3.0.
* Worked with Divine to provide input on blockers for deploying endpoints.
* Tested the endpoint post-deployment.
* The Data API is now fully functional on Supabase tables and deployed to PROD.

***Note: We encountered some blockers during the migration, as we needed to ensure there was no downtime when deploying the dashboard and endpoints. This took more time than expected, so we are raising the complexity by 1 point

Jam -*** [https://jam.dev/c/93590a05-304d-4819-8327-69c1c921a28e](https://jam.dev/c/93590a05-304d-4819-8327-69c1c921a28e)

data.title: Implement the Privy embedded wallet integration on LIFI widget
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Privy Embedded Wallet Integration on LIFI Widget

**Description:**  
Integrate the Privy embedded wallet into the LIFI widget to enable users to manage and execute cryptocurrency transactions seamlessly within the widget interface.

**Business Rationale:**  
Adding Privy's embedded wallet will enhance the user experience by providing secure and convenient transaction capabilities directly within the LIFI widget. This integration is expected to increase user engagement, streamline transaction processes, and potentially drive higher transaction volumes through improved functionality.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Integration Functionality:** Privy wallet is fully embedded and accessible within the LIFI widget.
2. **Transaction Capabilities:** Users can perform essential wallet operations, including sending, receiving, and viewing balances, without exiting the widget.
3. **Security Compliance:** The integration adheres to all security standards and passes comprehensive security testing.
4. **Cross-Platform Compatibility:** The embedded wallet operates correctly on all supported devices and browsers with responsive design.
5. **User Documentation:** Updated documentation is available, detailing the usage and features of the integrated Privy wallet within the LIFI widget.

comments.body: This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6836). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Platform Issue - Users can't login or Page Keeps Refreshing
data.description:
**Description:** Users are encountering an issue where every login attempt either redirects them back to the login page, indicating they are not logged in, or logs them in but continuously refreshes the page. Despite clearing their cache, the problem persists. I have also tested this on my end and experienced the same issue.

data.title: Customer disgruntled about platform plan. "Where's my advanced plan?"
data.description:
I've paid for the advanced plan. Why does my account only show the basic plan? Every time I tell customer support about it, they say it should be working now. When I log in it works until I log out. It goes right back to the basic plan when I login again. What's the problem?

**regineld2003@yahoo.com**

![Screenshot 2025-03-21 at 15.46.22.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/ec845539-305a-4e88-9e9c-9324e80d9809/a208f69e-3af6-48f7-9dc1-2298028ab142)

comments.body: Waiting for user's feedback but will close temporarily.
@val user has correct price now, please confirm and move to done. Thanks.

Oh I see. It seems we have more than 1 price link for this cause I saw this is active: [https://dashboard.stripe.com/prices/price_1N30MfH2HittHxxTM63VCklf](https://dashboard.stripe.com/prices/price_1N30MfH2HittHxxTM63VCklf) 

Please could you help update?🙏🏾

@suleman 

![Screenshot 2025-03-24 at 12.15.13.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/dec5596f-d9f3-4024-91b4-3e6c92191a0a/6f50b5dc-c255-4cc8-928c-4010637fac3c)

@val it'll keep going back to basic still, even if we make that price active, that price doesn't have the metadata needed because it's old and doesn't support the new flow of subscriptions.

Btw the price is still archived on stripe: [https://dashboard.stripe.com/prices/price_1R00RHH2HittHxxTtiCmrhHP](https://dashboard.stripe.com/prices/price_1R00RHH2HittHxxTtiCmrhHP)

Currently on ADVANCED:

![Screenshot 2025-03-24 at 12.21.46.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/771373f3-d342-4bf2-abe1-fc9048b1cc25/b01f5fee-7d02-4ab0-987e-2e25242a673b)

This user is using an old price and Suleman had mentioned before that the price was archived on Stripe, this was why it keeps going back to Basic. I sent a message to Zai regarding this if he can set the price active and on stripe, it is active so I am not sure why it keeps going back to Basic.

CC:  @suleman 

I will update the plan on Snowflake.

![Screenshot 2025-03-24 at 12.15.13.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/0d8fc341-db05-49c2-858d-4aabde18bacb/a08a34c1-0b7e-4e28-be49-9e57a94580da)
**regineld2003@yahoo.com**

data.title: Swap Widget Not Displaying on Token Details Page in Brave Browser
data.description:
The swap widget is not showing up when using brave browser 
 [https://jam.dev/c/c5ffa590-e70f-41be-89af-9cf5d241c616](https://jam.dev/c/c5ffa590-e70f-41be-89af-9cf5d241c616)

**Description:**
Users are unable to see the swap widget when accessing the token details page using the Brave browser. This issue impairs the ability to perform token swaps directly from the details page, potentially reducing user engagement and transaction volume.

**Business Rationale:**
Ensuring compatibility with the Brave browser is essential to accommodate a privacy-conscious segment of our user base. Resolving this issue will enhance user experience, maintain platform accessibility across popular browsers, and support continued user growth and retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The swap widget is visible and fully functional on the token details page when accessed via the latest version of Brave browser.
* No console errors related to the swap widget appear in Brave.
* Users can successfully complete token swaps without encountering issues specific to Brave.
* Compatibility is verified across different versions of the Brave browser as applicable.

comments.body: This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6805). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Filter Out Low-Quality Tokens on Gainers Tab
data.description:
[Showing Bad Tokens on Gainers Need Volume Filter ](https://jam.dev/c/eac9e3cf-49ff-46d0-9db9-8f565413b487)
we need to filter out bad tokens with  zero mcap and <$100,000 volume on gainers tab

**Description:**
Implement filters on the Gainers tab to exclude tokens with a market capitalization of zero and those with a trading volume below $100,000. This ensures that only reliable and actively traded tokens are displayed to users.

**Business Rationale:**
Filtering out low-market-cap and low-volume tokens enhances the quality of the Gainers list, providing users with more trustworthy and relevant information. This improves user experience. and helps maintain the credibility of the ratings page.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Tokens with a market capitalization of zero are not displayed on the Gainers tab.
2. Tokens with a 24-hour trading volume below $100,000 are excluded from the Gainers list.
3. The Gainers tab updates dynamically to reflect the applied filters.
4. Verified tokens on the Gainers tab meet both the market cap and volume criteria.
5. No impact on the performance or loading time of the Gainers page after implementing the filters.

comments.body: @ankit please use the same filters from the market page as the default filters for the ratings page
that ticket was done only for markets page and not ratings page. So @ankit will need to implement it separately here.
yeah this is for ratings page although the related ticket would have handled this issue if it was implemented across the platform, was that the case @suleman?

hi @ian, I think the ticket is related to the rating page, when the user clicks on the gainer, it will always apply the market cap and volume filters in the background
please confirm @ayo

@ayo @ankit this was already resolved here: [ENG-4721](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-4721/24hr-pricing-data-missing-market-page-filters-need-updating) 

@suleman what's preventing that ticket from being deployed to prod?
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.description:

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Build Frontend for Data API v2

**Description:**
Develop the frontend interface for Data API v2 following the UI design provided [here](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=12376-45206).

**Business Rationale:**
Upgrading to Data API v2 with a new frontend will enhance user experience, streamline data interactions, and support advanced features, thereby increasing user satisfaction and driving higher engagement with the V1 Token Metrics AI Indices platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Frontend design matches the Figma specifications accurately.
* All Data API v2 endpoints are fully integrated and operational.
* Responsive design is implemented for desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
* Cross-browser compatibility is verified for major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).
* Comprehensive unit and integration tests are completed with all tests passing.
* Successful user acceptance testing with no critical issues reported.

data.title: AI Indices Bugs (Test Party)
data.description:
1. \[Suleman\] When clicking on any other page number in the pagination section when we only have records for 1 page the ui gets distorted, all the page numbers get hidden and next/back buttons seem to get disabled. Also it starts saying `Page 2 of 1` which is not correct: [https://jam.dev/c/776ed0bb-b59f-4ac4-81af-4dc9c4205a57](https://jam.dev/c/776ed0bb-b59f-4ac4-81af-4dc9c4205a57)
 2. \[Suleman\] When clicking on any index from `All Indices` table, it should show a top loader when redirecting to that specific index page so user knows it's not a dead click while redirecting.
 3. \[Vasilis\] Index Main Page : In Summary table we have pagination, though we have empty data from page 2
 4. \[Vasilis\] Index Price History Chart : we need to rescale the data for each timeframe to always start from 0
 5. \[Vasilis\] Index Details page | gauge bar : percent should be rounded
 6. \[Vasilis\] Index Details page : mcap and fdv charts drop to 0 (we need to find a workaround to this or remove them - Abdullah said avg market cap/fdv/volume don't make sense)
 7. \[Vasilis\] Index Details page : Similar Indices show Indices with zeros
 8. \[Vasilis\] Index Details page : there's a bug in the Action field (for Meme index, 30197 is shown as increase, where it's a buy)
 9. \[Abdullah\] In index price history we need to add time scale and units across the horizontal axis. [https://jam.dev/c/4e878bfe-186b-402a-b0f7-6c4d68406de4](https://jam.dev/c/4e878bfe-186b-402a-b0f7-6c4d68406de4)
10. \[Williams\] Make column on the right and left fixed: [https://jam.dev/c/c7ecd930-9ed8-485a-a091-9a1f59e0f062](https://jam.dev/c/c7ecd930-9ed8-485a-a091-9a1f59e0f062)
11. \[Suleman\] On sector indices details page when clicking on `Similar Index` tab on top bar, it scrolls far below the actual `Similar Indices` section, It should only scroll till the point where section actually starts: [https://jam.dev/c/ad37ea48-2308-4811-a12e-ba25c6622802](https://jam.dev/c/ad37ea48-2308-4811-a12e-ba25c6622802)
12. \[Abdullah\] The vertical axis in the index price history should be a %. Even if it is a multiplier, the (X) symbol should be mentioned for more clarity. [https://jam.dev/c/49b3a61c-947f-4d78-baac-98bb37ec43d5](https://jam.dev/c/49b3a61c-947f-4d78-baac-98bb37ec43d5)
13. \[Faith\] Index Details Page: Include a rebalance note stating, *"Index rebalances after each week." -* [https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=12199-26262&t=wDEd8jKab3APA2i9-4](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=12199-26262&t=wDEd8jKab3APA2i9-4)
14. \[Abdullah\] We only have 1 page of indices right now. No need to have 6 pages to select. Just a next-page option should be enough. [https://jam.dev/c/58c7df7f-392b-44ed-8149-447d3964365f](https://jam.dev/c/58c7df7f-392b-44ed-8149-447d3964365f)

data.title: [Group] - Trading Agent Launch Agent Testing
data.description:
## **Title1:** USDT Not Displaying in Launch Agent When Both USDT and USDC Are Available on Solana Chain

**Description:**
When using the **Solana chain**, both **USDT** and **USDC** are available in the wallet. However, when attempting to **Launch Agent**, only **USDC** is displayed, and **USDT** is missing. This issue prevents users from selecting **USDT** as an option when both tokens should be visible.

[https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd](https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd)

## Title2: USDT and USDC Not Displaying on Solana Chain Despite Being Available

**Description:**
Even though both **USDT** and **USDC** are available in the wallet on the **Solana chain**, neither of them is displayed in the relevant sections (e.g., **Launch Agent** or token selection). This issue prevents users from seeing or selecting either of the tokens when they should both be visible.

[https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd](https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd)

## **Title3:** "Launch Agent" Button States "Will Enable in 30 Seconds" But Does Not Enable

**Description:**
When clicking the **"Launch Agent"** button, the message **"Will enable in 30 seconds"** appears, but the agent does not actually enable within the expected 30 seconds. This issue affects the functionality and causes confusion, as users are left waiting without the expected result.

[https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b](https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b)

## **Title4:** "Failed to Launch Agent" Error When Clicking "Launch Agent" Button Twice 

**Description:**
When clicking the **"Launch Agent"** button twice in quick succession, the error message **"Failed to launch agent"** appears. To prevent this issue, the **Launch Agent** button should be **disabled** until the agent has successfully launched, preventing users from accidentally triggering multiple requests. @ben @ayo 

[https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b](https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b)

## **Title5:** Incorrect Token Displayed for BSC Chain When ETH and Solana Wallets Are Available

**Description:**
When selecting the **BSC chain** in the **All Trading Agents** section, **USDC** is still displayed, despite the fact that there is no **BSC** chain available in the wallet. This is happening even though **ETH** and **Solana** wallets are present, and the expected tokens for the selected chains should be shown instead of USDC.

[https://jam.dev/c/299b068a-07c1-4b7a-aa10-19be705bde44](https://jam.dev/c/299b068a-07c1-4b7a-aa10-19be705bde44)

## **Title6:** Wallet Icon Missing Next to Funded Amount in Wallet Screen

**Description:**
In the **Wallet screen**, the **wallet icon** is missing next to the **funded amount**. This causes inconsistency in the UI and affects the clarity and design of the wallet section, as users are unable to see the relevant icon next to the amount they have funded.

[https://jam.dev/c/d76246ce-b3c6-4f73-9db1-1046470a695c](https://jam.dev/c/d76246ce-b3c6-4f73-9db1-1046470a695c)

## **Title7:** Typo in "Securely transfer your assets to anot her wallet" Text

**Description:**
There is a typo in the text **"Securely transfer your assets to anot her wallet"**, where the word **"another"** is incorrectly written as **"anot her"**

[https://jam.dev/c/db8be0bc-44b7-4694-adc9-987ad00adcf7](https://jam.dev/c/db8be0bc-44b7-4694-adc9-987ad00adcf7)

## **Title8:** "MAX" Button Not Working on Withdraw Funds Screen

**Description:**
In the **Withdraw Funds** screen, the **"MAX"** button does not function as expected. When clicking the button, it does not fill the field with the maximum withdrawable amount, preventing users from quickly withdrawing the full balance.

[https://jam.dev/c/1f84c78f-c8b9-44e6-be4f-03c3c16a9f94](https://jam.dev/c/1f84c78f-c8b9-44e6-be4f-03c3c16a9f94)

## **Title9:** Token Name Displayed in Lowercase in Token Dropdown on Withdraw Funds Popup

**Description:**
In the **Withdraw Funds** popup, the token names in the **Token dropdown** are displayed in **lowercase** letters, which causes a visual inconsistency. 

[https://jam.dev/c/7ef3a015-0bd7-4bac-a6ef-66aa63d403f2](https://jam.dev/c/7ef3a015-0bd7-4bac-a6ef-66aa63d403f2)

## **Title10:** Unable to Select USDC in Wallet on Withdraw Funds Section

**Description:**
Despite having **USDC** in the wallet, it is not selectable in the **Withdraw Funds** section. This prevents users from withdrawing USDC, which is expected to be available as an option, leading to an incomplete or faulty user experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/20e4251f-ce77-429a-8818-da5b39997c70](https://jam.dev/c/20e4251f-ce77-429a-8818-da5b39997c70)

## **Title11:** Withdraw Funds Functionality Not Working

**Description:**
The **Withdraw Funds** feature is not working as expected. When attempting to withdraw funds, the action does not proceed, and users are unable to complete the withdrawal. This issue prevents users from accessing their funds.

[https://jam.dev/c/6552a32c-620e-42b9-b962-185e7b6ad00e](https://jam.dev/c/6552a32c-620e-42b9-b962-185e7b6ad00e)

## **Title12:** "Enable Delegate" Should Be "Delegate Actions" and "Revoke Actions" Missing in Wallet Settings

**Description:**
In the **Wallet settings**, the text currently shows **"Enable Delegate"**, but according to the **Figma design**, it should be changed to **"Delegate Actions"**. Additionally, the **"Revoke Actions"** option specified in the **Figma design** is missing from the Wallet settings, which causes inconsistency with the intended design.

[https://jam.dev/c/14f21c98-96c5-433c-b1c3-2043b312f7a1](https://jam.dev/c/14f21c98-96c5-433c-b1c3-2043b312f7a1)

## **Title13:** "Hold to Reveal Private Key" Button Not Working

**Description:**
The **"Hold to Reveal Private Key"** button is not functioning as expected. When attempting to hold the button to reveal the private key, nothing happens, and the private key is not displayed. This issue prevents users from accessing their private key as intended.

[https://jam.dev/c/6d472d7b-8a26-4c9a-90f8-9961fb441a78](https://jam.dev/c/6d472d7b-8a26-4c9a-90f8-9961fb441a78)

## **Title14:** Missing "Select Token Balance" Header and Missing Dropdown for "Select a token to trade with"

**Description:**
In the relevant section, the **"Select Token Balance"** header is missing, and the dropdown for **"Select a token to trade with"** is not visible, even though it should be present under this header according to the design. This omission leads to confusion as users are unable to select a token for trading.

[https://jam.dev/c/e6b519c3-6f4e-43c1-a1c2-41bb705d5be6](https://jam.dev/c/e6b519c3-6f4e-43c1-a1c2-41bb705d5be6)

## **Title:15:** Text Update Needed for "Enter Amount to Invest" and Placeholder Text

**Description:**
The text **"Enter Amount to Invest"** should be updated to match the **Figma design**, which specifies it should read as **"Enter Trading Amount"**. Additionally, the **placeholder** text should be updated to **"Enter amount to invest"** as per the Figma design, ensuring consistency across the UI.

[https://jam.dev/c/afac946c-239f-436c-93bc-48aa06992c00](https://jam.dev/c/afac946c-239f-436c-93bc-48aa06992c00)

## **Title16:** Page Redirects to the Bottom When Selecting a Different Wallet Address

**Description:**
When selecting a **different wallet address** in the wallet selection section, the page unexpectedly redirects to the **bottom**, which disrupts the user experience. Users are unable to stay at their current position on the page, leading to frustration and an incomplete experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/cdef0b52-8690-43d5-84f5-453718662a82](https://jam.dev/c/cdef0b52-8690-43d5-84f5-453718662a82)

## **Title17:** "Enter Amount to Invest" Textbox Should Display "$ Count USDT/USDC"

**Description:**
In the **"Enter Amount to Invest"** textbox, the text currently only displays **"$"** and aligns the **count** to the right. However, as per the **design specification**, it should display the **"$ Count USDT/USDC"** format, where the token type (either **USDT** or **USDC**) is shown along with the amount. Please check figma.

[https://jam.dev/c/1262c8dc-cb35-47e1-8b4f-36c72d067613](https://jam.dev/c/1262c8dc-cb35-47e1-8b4f-36c72d067613)

issues.full_context:
Title: [Group] - Trading Agent Launch Agent Testing

Description:
## **Title1:** USDT Not Displaying in Launch Agent When Both USDT and USDC Are Available on Solana Chain

**Description:**
When using the **Solana chain**, both **USDT** and **USDC** are available in the wallet. However, when attempting to **Launch Agent**, only **USDC** is displayed, and **USDT** is missing. This issue prevents users from selecting **USDT** as an option when both tokens should be visible.

[https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd](https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd)

## Title2: USDT and USDC Not Displaying on Solana Chain Despite Being Available

**Description:**
Even though both **USDT** and **USDC** are available in the wallet on the **Solana chain**, neither of them is displayed in the relevant sections (e.g., **Launch Agent** or token selection). This issue prevents users from seeing or selecting either of the tokens when they should both be visible.

[https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd](https://jam.dev/c/8fb4ecae-1cfc-450c-b2d8-c593688bf9dd)

## **Title3:** "Launch Agent" Button States "Will Enable in 30 Seconds" But Does Not Enable

**Description:**
When clicking the **"Launch Agent"** button, the message **"Will enable in 30 seconds"** appears, but the agent does not actually enable within the expected 30 seconds. This issue affects the functionality and causes confusion, as users are left waiting without the expected result.

[https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b](https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b)

## **Title4:** "Failed to Launch Agent" Error When Clicking "Launch Agent" Button Twice 

**Description:**
When clicking the **"Launch Agent"** button twice in quick succession, the error message **"Failed to launch agent"** appears. To prevent this issue, the **Launch Agent** button should be **disabled** until the agent has successfully launched, preventing users from accidentally triggering multiple requests. @ben @ayo 

[https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b](https://jam.dev/c/f307ce62-c68d-4e48-a90a-ed0adcbb345b)

## **Title5:** Incorrect Token Displayed for BSC Chain When ETH and Solana Wallets Are Available

**Description:**
When selecting the **BSC chain** in the **All Trading Agents** section, **USDC** is still displayed, despite the fact that there is no **BSC** chain available in the wallet. This is happening even though **ETH** and **Solana** wallets are present, and the expected tokens for the selected chains should be shown instead of USDC.

[https://jam.dev/c/299b068a-07c1-4b7a-aa10-19be705bde44](https://jam.dev/c/299b068a-07c1-4b7a-aa10-19be705bde44)

## **Title6:** Wallet Icon Missing Next to Funded Amount in Wallet Screen

**Description:**
In the **Wallet screen**, the **wallet icon** is missing next to the **funded amount**. This causes inconsistency in the UI and affects the clarity and design of the wallet section, as users are unable to see the relevant icon next to the amount they have funded.

[https://jam.dev/c/d76246ce-b3c6-4f73-9db1-1046470a695c](https://jam.dev/c/d76246ce-b3c6-4f73-9db1-1046470a695c)

## **Title7:** Typo in "Securely transfer your assets to anot her wallet" Text

**Description:**
There is a typo in the text **"Securely transfer your assets to anot her wallet"**, where the word **"another"** is incorrectly written as **"anot her"**

[https://jam.dev/c/db8be0bc-44b7-4694-adc9-987ad00adcf7](https://jam.dev/c/db8be0bc-44b7-4694-adc9-987ad00adcf7)

## **Title8:** "MAX" Button Not Working on Withdraw Funds Screen

**Description:**
In the **Withdraw Funds** screen, the **"MAX"** button does not function as expected. When clicking the button, it does not fill the field with the maximum withdrawable amount, preventing users from quickly withdrawing the full balance.

[https://jam.dev/c/1f84c78f-c8b9-44e6-be4f-03c3c16a9f94](https://jam.dev/c/1f84c78f-c8b9-44e6-be4f-03c3c16a9f94)

## **Title9:** Token Name Displayed in Lowercase in Token Dropdown on Withdraw Funds Popup

**Description:**
In the **Withdraw Funds** popup, the token names in the **Token dropdown** are displayed in **lowercase** letters, which causes a visual inconsistency. 

[https://jam.dev/c/7ef3a015-0bd7-4bac-a6ef-66aa63d403f2](https://jam.dev/c/7ef3a015-0bd7-4bac-a6ef-66aa63d403f2)

## **Title10:** Unable to Select USDC in Wallet on Withdraw Funds Section

**Description:**
Despite having **USDC** in the wallet, it is not selectable in the **Withdraw Funds** section. This prevents users from withdrawing USDC, which is expected to be available as an option, leading to an incomplete or faulty user experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/20e4251f-ce77-429a-8818-da5b39997c70](https://jam.dev/c/20e4251f-ce77-429a-8818-da5b39997c70)

## **Title11:** Withdraw Funds Functionality Not Working

**Description:**
The **Withdraw Funds** feature is not working as expected. When attempting to withdraw funds, the action does not proceed, and users are unable to complete the withdrawal. This issue prevents users from accessing their funds.

[https://jam.dev/c/6552a32c-620e-42b9-b962-185e7b6ad00e](https://jam.dev/c/6552a32c-620e-42b9-b962-185e7b6ad00e)

## **Title12:** "Enable Delegate" Should Be "Delegate Actions" and "Revoke Actions" Missing in Wallet Settings

**Description:**
In the **Wallet settings**, the text currently shows **"Enable Delegate"**, but according to the **Figma design**, it should be changed to **"Delegate Actions"**. Additionally, the **"Revoke Actions"** option specified in the **Figma design** is missing from the Wallet settings, which causes inconsistency with the intended design.

[https://jam.dev/c/14f21c98-96c5-433c-b1c3-2043b312f7a1](https://jam.dev/c/14f21c98-96c5-433c-b1c3-2043b312f7a1)

## **Title13:** "Hold to Reveal Private Key" Button Not Working

**Description:**
The **"Hold to Reveal Private Key"** button is not functioning as expected. When attempting to hold the button to reveal the private key, nothing happens, and the private key is not displayed. This issue prevents users from accessing their private key as intended.

[https://jam.dev/c/6d472d7b-8a26-4c9a-90f8-9961fb441a78](https://jam.dev/c/6d472d7b-8a26-4c9a-90f8-9961fb441a78)

## **Title14:** Missing "Select Token Balance" Header and Missing Dropdown for "Select a token to trade with"

**Description:**
In the relevant section, the **"Select Token Balance"** header is missing, and the dropdown for **"Select a token to trade with"** is not visible, even though it should be present under this header according to the design. This omission leads to confusion as users are unable to select a token for trading.

[https://jam.dev/c/e6b519c3-6f4e-43c1-a1c2-41bb705d5be6](https://jam.dev/c/e6b519c3-6f4e-43c1-a1c2-41bb705d5be6)

## **Title:15:** Text Update Needed for "Enter Amount to Invest" and Placeholder Text

**Description:**
The text **"Enter Amount to Invest"** should be updated to match the **Figma design**, which specifies it should read as **"Enter Trading Amount"**. Additionally, the **placeholder** text should be updated to **"Enter amount to invest"** as per the Figma design, ensuring consistency across the UI.

[https://jam.dev/c/afac946c-239f-436c-93bc-48aa06992c00](https://jam.dev/c/afac946c-239f-436c-93bc-48aa06992c00)

## **Title16:** Page Redirects to the Bottom When Selecting a Different Wallet Address

**Description:**
When selecting a **different wallet address** in the wallet selection section, the page unexpectedly redirects to the **bottom**, which disrupts the user experience. Users are unable to stay at their current position on the page, leading to frustration and an incomplete experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/cdef0b52-8690-43d5-84f5-453718662a82](https://jam.dev/c/cdef0b52-8690-43d5-84f5-453718662a82)

**Description:**
In the **"Enter Amount to Invest"** textbox, the text currently only displays **"$"** and aligns the **count** to the right. However, as per the **design specification**, it should display the **"$ Count USDT/USDC"** format, where the token type (either **USDT** or **USDC**) is shown along with the amount. Please check figma.

data.title: NFT Burn-To-Stake QA 2
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** NFT Burn-To-Stake QA/Testing

**Description:** Conduct comprehensive quality assurance and testing for the Astrobot NFT Burn-to-Stake conversion feature within the V1 DAO Governance and Staking platform. Ensure that the burn-to-stake functionality operates seamlessly, allowing users to convert their NFTs into staking benefits without issues.

**Business Rationale:** Validating the Burn-to-Stake feature is essential to enhance user engagement and the utility of Astrobot NFTs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Burn-to-Stake transactions execute successfully without errors.
2. The user interface reflects the burn and staking status correctly.
3. All relevant test cases are documented and pass successfully.

Found bug list:

[ENG-5286](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-5286/[group]-burn-to-stake-platform-testing-2)

data.title: Annotation and Feedback Routine for Chatbot Responses - Cycle 41
data.description:
**Description:** To improve the chatbot's accuracy and usefulness, allocate an hour each week for reviewing and annotating its responses. This involves providing constructive feedback on chatbot answers, identifying areas for improvement, and submitting annotated examples via **LangSmith**

for an overview on giving feedback to the chatbot answers to make them more useful (annotating). It will really help with our fine tuning

### **Steps to Implement:**

1. **Weekly Feedback Routine:**
   * Schedule a dedicated hour each week for annotation and feedback.l).

* Evaluate the answers for:
  * Accuracy
  * Clarity
  * Relevance
  * Completeness
* Annotate suggestions or corrections for improvements directly in LangSmith.

1. **Annotating Responses:**
   * Highlight areas where the response is incorrect, vague, or incomplete.
   * Mark high-quality responses as examples of best practices.
   * Example: [https://jam.dev/c/a410f1f8-42fd-46c0-a7c8-5a0420eba9a6](https://jam.dev/c/a410f1f8-42fd-46c0-a7c8-5a0420eba9a6)
   * [https://jam.dev/c/fe976069-9934-4fa0-a7f3-6155ab09bf3d](https://jam.dev/c/fe976069-9934-4fa0-a7f3-6155ab09bf3d)

data.title: Run Specific Cypress Test Modules via GitHub (Multiselect)
data.description:
**Description**: Implement the ability to run specific Cypress test modules (e.g., login, ratings page, market page) directly through GitHub, instead of running all tests. This will allow selective test execution for different modules based on the need.

**Acceptance Criteria**:

1. **Test Selection**:
   * The user should be able to select a specific Cypress test module (e.g., login, ratings page, market page) to run from GitHub.
   * The selection of test modules will be done using the GitHub Actions workflow, where a specific spec file is chosen for execution.
2. **GitHub Actions Configuration**:
   * The Cypress tests should be organized into spec files based on different modules (e.g., `login.spec.js`, `ratings-page.spec.js`, `market-page.spec.js`).
   * A GitHub Actions workflow should be configured to trigger Cypress tests based on the selected spec.
   * The workflow should allow manual selection of the test module to be run using the `workflow_dispatch` feature in GitHub Actions.
3. **Manual Trigger**:
   * The user can manually trigger the workflow from GitHub and specify the module they want to test.
   * The available options for selection (e.g., `login.spec.js`, `ratings-page.spec.js`, `market-page.spec.js`) should be passed as input when triggering the workflow.
4. **Environment Configuration**:
   * Ensure that the `CYPRESS_SPEC` environment variable is used in the GitHub Actions workflow to specify the test module (spec file) to be executed.
   * The test execution should only run the selected spec file, not the entire suite of tests.
5. **Expected Outcome**:
   * When the user selects a specific test module (e.g., login), only the corresponding tests for that module should run.
   * The output of the test run should display results for the selected module, and the workflow should complete successfully.

comments.body: For Demo: [https://jam.dev/c/44e73186-e2ef-495d-8046-c981c4fc60aa](https://jam.dev/c/44e73186-e2ef-495d-8046-c981c4fc60aa)

data.title: [Staging] Some Values Displays as $NaN in Trader-Current Index Holdings Despite Data Availability
data.description:
**Description:**
In the **Trader-Current Index Holdings**, the **Cash Value** is displayed as **$NaN** (Not a Number), even though there is valid data available for the cash value. This results in an incorrect display and may confuse users.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the **Trader-Current Index Holdings** section.
2. Observe the **Cash/Initial/Current Value** field.
3. Shown as **$NaN**, despite there being valid data

data.title: Dynamic data api plans
data.description:
1. On data api settings page, based on user's current `veTMAI` tokens show them relevant plans which they can subscribe to whenever their `SUBSCRIPTION` column is `NULL` in data api table:

![Screenshot 2025-03-18 at 11.39.21 PM.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/36e6d707-f360-4c59-b51a-d246b44d9b7b/67eda63e-c56e-49ed-bd05-ae09bd9189c3)

2. Create new webhook functions to handle data api subscriptions separately from analytics.
3. Add metadata `dataAPI` as `true` under all the products or prices which relate to data api and based on this metadata handle webhooks appropriately.
4. Whenever a new subscription is purchased by user get the subscription total calls data from in memory object representing above table and update the record's columns in data api table as per defined:
   1. TOTAL_API_CALLS - <whatever calls we got from object for this tier>
   2. USED_API_CALLS - 0
   3. ADDITIONAL_CALLS - 0
   4. SUBSCRIPTION - whole stripe subscription object
5. Whenever a user cancels a subscription handle update webhook as per defined below:
   1. When `status !== 'active'`: this means subscription was either canceled or past due or incomplete so revert data api table columns to initial state:
      1. TOTAL_API_CALLS - 50
      2. USED_API_CALLS - 0
      3. ADDITIONAL_CALLS - 0
      4. SUBSCRIPTION - null
   2. When `status === 'active'`: this means subscription data was updated, just compare the subscription price or product and see if it's same as current stored `SUBSCRIPTION` column if yes, then do nothing. if no, then update the data api columns as per new subscription data in the object.
6. Whenever user uses data api to fetch records add relevant data regarding the request in this data api usage table so we can show charts/stats on frontend:
   1. 

      ![Screenshot 2025-03-18 at 11.53.17 PM.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/281a4c32-c59b-49ed-8231-482ebe54acd6/ab4a2eb8-2358-41ba-87b9-953c909d0e35)

comments.body: @harshg yes sure.
@suleman  then, can I work on the V2 designs after completing the UI for displaying Data API plans as we discussed, or is there anything else I can work on to support Stake to access currently ?
yes
@suleman are you handling the subscription related stuff ?

data.title: Implement dynamic trading fee for swaps
data.description:
1. Whenever a user is logged in and their email ends with `@vetmai.com` we need to calculate their fee dynamically.
2. Whenever that specific user tries to swap tokens we should pick up their wallet address from email doing something like `email.split('@')[0]` and then use that wallet address to fetch user's `veTMAI` tokens amount in their wallet (cache this value in `useQuery` for 1 day and do polling (refetching) with interval of 5 minutes) from the backend api endpoint.

comments.body: @suleman if the Stripe payments for the API works like the crypto payments, where users can pay with fiat and crypto, then we can keep it. Please confirm.

@ian currently the architecture that we finalized use stripe for data api subscriptions as it is easier to offload handling payments to them along with any metered usage. If we don't want to use stripe at all then we need to create a whole new flow to manage these payments/renews/metered/prorations/charges etc on our end which is a big task of it's own.

If we still have plenty of time for this project to be delivered then we can plan for that and remove stripe altogether, but if not then I think we should go with stripe for v1 and then use TMAI entirely in further updates.

Yes we are fetching these details from smart contract, this ticket just explains what needs to be done to achieve that and how the final flow will look like. 

Regarding stripe we still do need it for data api subscription so it's only limited to that, all other discounts and stuff will be fetched and calculated based on staking score from smart contract only.
@suleman if we're going away from email and Stripe (SaaS model), can we use their plan info from their staking score? In the past we've had issues using the email method with Astrobots.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6733). All replies are displayed in both locations.

issues.full_context:
Title: Implement dynamic trading fee for swaps

Description:
1. Whenever a user is logged in and their email ends with `@vetmai.com` we need to calculate their fee dynamically.
2. Whenever that specific user tries to swap tokens we should pick up their wallet address from email doing something like `email.split('@')[0]` and then use that wallet address to fetch user's `veTMAI` tokens amount in their wallet (cache this value in `useQuery` for 1 day and do polling (refetching) with interval of 5 minutes) from the backend api endpoint.

data.title: Signin with TMAI
data.description:
1. Create signin api endpoint, that accepts user's wallet address and a signed message:
   1. Verify the provided sign is from the current wallet address (making sure the ownership of the wallet).
   2. Check if a user with this wallet already exists in database:
      1. Yes: just login the user with dummy password created for them.
      2. No:
         1. Create a new user with this email **<wallet address>@vetmai.com** and generate a random text for password with determine user's `PLAN_KEY` column by fetching their `veTMAI` tokens from smart contract and picking up a plan based on those tokens as defined in the table below under `TIER` column (plan key should always be uppercase):

            ![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXeycriMz87DNHG_n-tiUB8WctIUYs41RJ6k2yL3vhUyGX3XgZZad0idCT6vyeWT9l9D6-ZiF56D99OvPXyNF0WF2whO4JLekW8LtKHxlzTxUhN_6o-RWvCDuXI4DrV2nRMDs28jVw?key=z-kYkCboL7Z7zLpsWlR_qINV)
         2. Also add this record in data api table for current user:
            1. total api calls: 500
            2. used api calls: 0
            3. additional calls: 0
            4. subscription: null
            5. user id: the id of created user.

Note: You can copy the flow from nft login as it'll be similar. The random generated password should be stored in a column named `GENERATED_PASSWORD` in `ANALYTICS.USERS` table so we can signin user again using that.

Data API table schema:

![Screenshot 2025-03-18 at 10.50.11 PM.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/9ea313b7-5e82-47f4-bd23-9c7f30ddcca6/37d23a77-ff87-46a2-8f86-e3e708bf50dd)

data.title: Advanced User Incorrectly Assigned to Basic Plan
data.description:
A user with an **Advanced** subscription incorrectly sees the **Basic** plan when accessing the platform. This is restricting access to Advanced features.

**User Details:**

* **Plan:** PREMIUM
* **Astrobot ID:** `0x005E9f8E7dE28bfAf94b74d33fD7fEfe5541f08d`
* **Issue Report:** [Jam Report](https://jam.dev/c/fe67ae05-b6b1-4d3d-bae5-b93e0bbc191c)

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. User logs into their account.
2. Instead of seeing **Advanced** plan access, they are assigned the **Basic** plan.
3. The user is unable to access Advanced features.

**Expected Behavior:**

* The user should have full access to the **Advanced** plan features.

**Actual Behavior:**

* The platform incorrectly assigns users to the **Basic** plan, limiting their access.

**Suggested Next Steps:**

* Check the user’s subscription status in the database.
* Verify the correct plan assignment in the backend.
* Investigate any sync issues between the payment system and user plan allocation.
* Manually update the user’s plan if needed and confirm the fix.
* Notify the user once the issue is resolved.

comments.body: Okay, yes, it is actually PREMIUM due to advanced. Thank you

@val in the jam dev you attached I see that user can see `ADVANCED`plan in his account but ticket description mentioned it shows them `BASIC`? Btw he now has `PREMIUM` plan in db cause of auto sync as he should get `PREMIUM` for advanced astrobot. Please confirm from user again. Thanks.

data.title: Implement A/B Test for Opt-In Free Trial Onboarding
data.description:
Description: We are introducing an A/B test where new users automatically receive a 7-day free trial to advanced features, including swap functionality and AI insights, without requiring a credit card. After the trial, users will receive an upgrade or staking TMAI prompt to encourage conversions. This test aims to measure user engagement, feature adoption, and conversion rates from trial users to paying subscribers or TMAI stakers.

Auto-assign a 7-day free trial to new users upon signup.
 Ensure trial users can access premium features (Trading on tokenmetrics , advanced analytics).
Set up trial expiration logic to revoke access after 7 days unless the user upgrades .
Trigger API event tracking to monitor trial user behavior in PostHog.ie create a feature flag for this 
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UJik72ZuZTEnZ4YZ8M6lfYWWqpGXUg1vMQ95wkH2SZ4/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UJik72ZuZTEnZ4YZ8M6lfYWWqpGXUg1vMQ95wkH2SZ4/edit?usp=sharing)

data.title: Create node affinity for applications to be attached to a particular node pool
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Implement Node Affinity and Scale Node Pool for Application Deployment

**Description:**
Configure node affinity to ensure applications are deployed to a designated node pool. Additionally, create a large node pool to support the vertical scaling of these applications.

**Business Rationale:**
Assigning applications to specific node pools optimizes resource utilization and enhances performance. Scaling the node pool vertically ensures that applications can handle increased workloads efficiently, leading to improved reliability and user satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Node affinity rules are defined and applied, ensuring targeted applications are scheduled on the specified node pool.
2. A large node pool is successfully created with sufficient resources to support vertical scaling.
3. Applications are deployed to the designated node pool and operate without resource constraints.
4. Documentation is updated to reflect the node affinity configurations and the specifications of the new node pool.

data.title: User is Unable to Complete Trades – Transactions Failing Across Multiple Wallets
data.description:
Users Unable to Complete Trades – Transactions Failing Across Multiple Wallets

A user reports persistent glitches on the platform, significantly impacting the user experience. Specifically, they attempted to trade over $1,000 using three different wallets, but none of the transactions were successful.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Attempt a trade on the platform using different wallets.
2. Observe if the transaction fails or does not process as expected.
3. Check for any error messages or failed transaction logs.

**Expected Behavior:**

* Users should be able to complete transactions seamlessly across supported wallets.

**Actual Behavior:**

* Transactions fail despite using different wallets, preventing trading activity.

issues.full_context:
Title: User is Unable to Complete Trades – Transactions Failing Across Multiple Wallets

Description:
Users Unable to Complete Trades – Transactions Failing Across Multiple Wallets

A user reports persistent glitches on the platform, significantly impacting the user experience. Specifically, they attempted to trade over $1,000 using three different wallets, but none of the transactions were successful.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Attempt a trade on the platform using different wallets.
2. Observe if the transaction fails or does not process as expected.
3. Check for any error messages or failed transaction logs.

**Expected Behavior:**

* Users should be able to complete transactions seamlessly across supported wallets.

**Actual Behavior:**

* Transactions fail despite using different wallets, preventing trading activity.
* Overall site stability appears shaky due to various glitches.

**User Details:**

* **Email:** prov.3v9@gmail.com

**Additional User Feedback:**
The user has been actively supporting the platform but finds these issues frustrating, affecting trust and usability.

**Attachments:**

[Screen Recording 2025-03-13 105907.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/5ebda2d3-4e7a-40be-92ce-c24df25f90f2/9973f470-ffa8-4eab-85d0-17e0d4cfc23c)

data.title: Private Launchpad Project Details Feedback Improvements Fix
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enhance Feedback Mechanism for Private Launchpad Project Details

**Description:** Improve the existing feedback system within the Private Launchpad to allow users to provide more detailed and structured feedback on project details. This includes adding new feedback fields, refining the user interface for easier submission, and implementing better categorization of feedback for analysis.

**Business Rationale:** A more robust feedback mechanism will facilitate better communication between users and project teams, leading to improved project quality and user satisfaction. By understanding user needs and concerns more effectively, the Private Launchpad can enhance its offerings and maintain a competitive edge.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **New Feedback Fields:** Additional fields such as rating scales, specific comment sections, and category selectors are added to the feedback form.
2. **User Interface Updates:** The feedback submission interface is redesigned for improved usability and accessibility.
3. **Feedback Categorization:** Implement categorization logic to organize feedback based on type and priority.
4. **Data Storage:** All feedback data is accurately captured and stored in the database for easy retrieval and analysis.
5. **Validation and Error Handling:** Ensure all new fields have proper validation and that the system gracefully handles any submission errors.
6. **Testing:** Conduct thorough testing to verify that the feedback mechanism works seamlessly across different devices and browsers.

data.title: Connect Wallet / Stake Section
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Connect Wallet and Stake Section for Private Launchpad Dashboard

**Description:**  
Implement the frontend functionality that allows users to connect their cryptocurrency wallets and stake tokens within the Private Launchpad’s Participate/Apply dashboard. This section should provide a seamless user experience for wallet integration and staking activities.

**Business Rationale:**  
Enabling wallet connection and staking is crucial for facilitating user participation in the Private Launchpad. It enhances user engagement, promotes token utilization, and supports the overall ecosystem by allowing users to invest and interact with launch projects directly through the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Users can connect their cryptocurrency wallets (e.g., MetaMask, WalletConnect) via the dashboard.
* Connected wallets display the user’s token balance and staking options accurately.
* Users can initiate staking and unstaking of tokens with confirmation prompts.
* Staking actions reflect in real-time on the user interface and backend.
* The feature adheres to security best practices, ensuring safe wallet interactions.
* The section is responsive and functions correctly across all supported browsers and devices.

data.title: Apply For Launchpad Section
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Frontend for Private Launchpad Participation Dashboard

**Description:**
Develop the frontend interface for the Private Launchpad's Participate/Apply dashboard. This section will enable users to view their application statuses, submit new applications, and manage their participation in launchpad initiatives.

**Business Rationale:**
Providing a streamlined and intuitive dashboard enhances user engagement and satisfaction by simplifying the application process and offering clear visibility into their participation status. This can lead to increased participation rates and overall success of the Private Launchpad program.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Users can log in and access the Participate/Apply dashboard.
* The dashboard displays a list of the user's current applications with real-time status updates.
* Users can submit new applications through a user-friendly form.
* Form includes necessary input validations and error messages for invalid entries.
* The interface is responsive and functions seamlessly across desktop and mobile devices.
* UI design aligns with the provided design specifications and branding guidelines.
* Successful submission of an application triggers a confirmation message.
* All functionalities are covered by unit and integration tests with at least 80% test coverage.

data.title: Separate API Usage Tracking from Users Table
data.description:
**Description:**
Currently, we track API usage using the `API_CALLS` and `API_USAGE_EXCEEDED` columns in the `users` table. This setup is suboptimal because:

* It increases read/write operations on the `users` table, which is already handling multiple other functionalities.
* High API usage levels can lead to blocking queues and failures in request completion and data updates.
* The tight coupling of API usage tracking with the `users` table is preventing a full migration of Data API to Prisma.

**Proposed Solution:**

* Extract `API_CALLS`, `API_USAGE_EXCEEDED`, and any other Data API-related columns from the `users` table.
* Create a new table named `DATA_API` with these columns and `USER_ID` to establish a one-to-one relationship with the `users` table.
* This will allow easy access to API usage data while reducing load on the `users` table.

**Action Items:**

* Create the `DATA_API` table.
* Migrate existing data from the `users` table.
* Update queries to fetch API usage from the new table.
* Test to ensure no disruptions in API tracking.

comments.body: This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6687). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: [Group] - Burn-to-Stake Platform Testing
data.description:
## **Title1:** "Your Astrobot NFTs" Section Not Aligned with Figma Design – Missing Connect Wallet Button

**Description:**
The **"Your Astrobot NFTs"** section does not match the **Figma design**. Specifically, the **"Connect Wallet"** button is missing in this section, which should be present according to the design. This causes a discrepancy between the actual implementation and the design specifications.

Actual Result: [https://jam.dev/c/09d6fd0d-50bf-4e05-9839-f12cd0826d49](https://jam.dev/c/09d6fd0d-50bf-4e05-9839-f12cd0826d49)

Expected Result: [https://jam.dev/c/46ac2954-9bb9-4310-9e9f-595c9632871b](https://jam.dev/c/46ac2954-9bb9-4310-9e9f-595c9632871b)

## **Title2:** "What Are Benefits" Text Should Be "Staking Benefits" as per Figma Design

**Description:**
The text **"What Are Benefits"** in the relevant section should be updated to **"Staking Benefits"**, as per the **Figma design**. [https://jam.dev/c/e2e99bf2-ea49-4be9-9227-b7b4a9cc76a0](https://jam.dev/c/e2e99bf2-ea49-4be9-9227-b7b4a9cc76a0)

## **Title3:** "Failed to Approve NFT for Bridging" Stuck in "Transaction Complete" Status

**Description:**
When the **"Failed to Approve NFT for Bridging"** transaction is not approved, it remains stuck in the **"Transaction Complete"** status. This causes confusion for users, as the transaction is marked as complete despite not being successfully processed.

[https://jam.dev/c/59afc819-32c0-401b-951f-a280f8059fe9](https://jam.dev/c/59afc819-32c0-401b-951f-a280f8059fe9)

## **Title4:** Missing Search Field for Astrobot NFTs as per Figma Design

**Description:**
The **search field** for **Astrobot NFTs** is missing from the page. According to the **Figma design**, there should be a **search field** that allows users to search for specific NFTs. The absence of this feature causes a discrepancy between the actual implementation and the design.

[https://jam.dev/c/84eff263-04d6-4720-9410-0dcf4ce48379](https://jam.dev/c/84eff263-04d6-4720-9410-0dcf4ce48379)

## **Title5:** "Burn & Stake" Button Placement Does Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The **"Burn & Stake"** button is not placed in the correct position as specified in the **Figma design**. The current placement of the button causes a mismatch with the intended layout, affecting the consistency of the user interface.

[https://jam.dev/c/16c52def-c521-447f-a628-2694ac164911](https://jam.dev/c/16c52def-c521-447f-a628-2694ac164911)

## **Title6:** Misalignment of "Base," "Execution," and "Total Fee" Values

**Description:**
The **"Base"**, **"Execution"**, and **"Total Fee"** values are not aligned properly on the page, causing visual inconsistency and affecting the overall layout.

The **search field** for **Astrobot NFTs** is missing from the page. According to the **Figma design**, there should be a **search field** that allows users to search for specific NFTs. The absence of this feature causes a discrepancy between the actual implementation and the design.

[https://jam.dev/c/84eff263-04d6-4720-9410-0dcf4ce48379](https://jam.dev/c/84eff263-04d6-4720-9410-0dcf4ce48379)

## **Title5:** "Burn & Stake" Button Placement Does Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The **"Burn & Stake"** button is not placed in the correct position as specified in the **Figma design**. The current placement of the button causes a mismatch with the intended layout, affecting the consistency of the user interface.

[https://jam.dev/c/16c52def-c521-447f-a628-2694ac164911](https://jam.dev/c/16c52def-c521-447f-a628-2694ac164911)

## **Title6:** Misalignment of "Base," "Execution," and "Total Fee" Values

**Description:**
The **"Base"**, **"Execution"**, and **"Total Fee"** values are not aligned properly on the page, causing visual inconsistency and affecting the overall layout.

data.title: Portfolio Feature - Front End - Use VirtualizedTable and IndexedDB for all Portfolio's Tables
data.description:
Since portfolio data is user-filtered and relatively small, we can initially fetch and store all data in IndexedDB. Subsequent updates will only fetch data newer than the latest stored IDs (based on creation time / id).
`src/components/TradingAgentV2/Indexeddb/portfolioTable.ts`

Also Integrate with Virtualized Table to improve performance.
`src/components/TradingAgentV2/Portfolio/TradingAgentTable.tsx`

data.title: Swap Function Failing with Server Error
data.description:
Description: The swap operation is failing due to a server error. This issue prevents the successful exchange of tokens and might result in user frustration.

[https://us.posthog.com/project/90552/replay/01958fa2-f017-79db-bf4a-767dc742d8ff?t=1570](https://us.posthog.com/project/90552/replay/01958fa2-f017-79db-bf4a-767dc742d8ff?t=1570)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve Server Errors Causing Swap Function Failures

**Description:**  
The token swap operation is currently failing due to server errors, preventing users from successfully exchanging tokens. This issue disrupts the trading experience and may lead to increased user frustration and decreased platform trust.

**Business Rationale:**  
Ensuring the reliability of the swap function is essential for maintaining user satisfaction and trust. Reliable token exchanges are fundamental to the platform's trading activities, directly impacting user retention, engagement, and overall revenue.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Error Resolution:** The swap function operates without server errors under normal and peak usage conditions.
2. **Successful Transactions:** Users can complete token exchanges without encountering failures.
3. **Performance Metrics:** Swap operation response times meet the defined performance standards.
4. **User Feedback:** Appropriate success and error messages are displayed to users, enhancing the user experience.
5. **Monitoring:** Implement monitoring tools to track swap function performance and promptly detect any future server issues.

comments.body: I am only seeing that user hasn't sign in the transaction on the wallet which is the required step to continue swapping.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6663). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: [PARENT] Stake-to-Access Implementation for Token Metrics
data.description:
The **Stake-to-Access** feature will drive user access across the **Token Metrics Platform**, including the **Analytics platform, Token Metrics API, Trading Agents, and Governance DAO**. Users stake TMAI tokens to unlock features, discounts, API access, and governance participation. This creates a hybrid model where **staking provides baseline access**, and **overages are handled via traditional payments**.

**Each user’s staking score (veTMAI) determines:**

* **Analytics platform tier (Advanced, Premium, VIP)**
* **Trading fee discounts**
* **Referral fee percentage**
* **Private sales allocation & Launchpad multiplier**
* **API plan (API calls/month, API overage cost, monthly fee)**
* **Access to exclusive weekly Premium Webinars**

To ensure **seamless integration**, various sections of the platform will dynamically adjust based on a user’s staking score.

This parent task outlines all the tasks that need to be completed by each of the teams to ensure the proper implementation of stake-to-access across the entire Token Metrics platform.

PRD: 

[docs.google.com](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fBuyLQxN8F_BRt8BX0bMYWRXsDgOOYmpBYuUkQ4audU/edit?usp=sharing)

data.title: Backend Team
data.description:
#### **Backend Team Tasks**

* **Modify API access control** to validate and return user privileges based on staking score.
* **Create a staking-aware authentication layer** that enforces tier-based access across:
  * Analytics platform (Ratings, Indices, Market insights)
  * API (Token Metrics API rate limits and overages)
  * Trading Agents
  * Governance DAO
* **Enable real-time updates for staking tiers** via API calls.
* **Implement dynamic fee calculations**, ensuring trading fee discounts apply automatically.
* **Develop an overage handling system** that prompts users to top-up payments when exceeding API quotas.
* **Ensure staking tier influences governance voting weight** within the DAO.
* **Integrate staking expiration & renewal logic** to notify users when their staking period ends.

data.title: Governance and Staking Platform
data.description:
Migrate all the queries from snowflake to postgres across all services in governance and staking dashboard.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Migrate Governance and Staking Dashboard Queries from Snowflake to Postgres

**Description:**

**Overview:**
Transition all database queries from Snowflake to Postgres across all services within the Governance and Staking Dashboard.

**Business Rationale:**
Migrating to Postgres will enhance system performance, reduce operational costs, and simplify maintenance by unifying our database infrastructure. This consolidation supports scalability and improves developer efficiency by leveraging existing technologies like Next.js and Prisma.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All Snowflake queries are successfully rewritten and optimized for Postgres.
* Application code in Next.js and Prisma is updated to interface with Postgres.
* Governance and Staking Dashboard functionalities operate seamlessly with the new Postgres backend.
* Comprehensive testing validates data integrity and system performance post-migration.
* Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the changes in the database configuration and query structure.

data.title: Create Token Metrics API Public GitHub Repository
data.description:
**Goal:** Create a public GitHub repo to host sample code, tutorials, and documentation for the TM API, making it accessible for hackathon participants and developers.

**Steps** 

* **Create the Repo:** Set up a new public repository on GitHub at github.com/tokenmetrics/tmai-api (or a similar name). Use a clear, descriptive name like “tmai-api-examples.”
* **Add Basic Content:**
  * **README.md:** Write a concise README with an overview of the TM API, links to documentation 
    
    [https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/docs/getting-started](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/docs/getting-started),
    
    and instructions for accessing the API via 
    
    [https://app.tokenmetrics.com/en/data-api](https://app.tokenmetrics.com/en/data-api).
  * **Sample Code:** Include 1–2 simple example scripts (e.g., Typescript, JavaScript, or Python) demonstrating how to use the TM API for basic market data retrieval or a trading signal query. 
    
    Use open-source libraries (e.g., requests for Python) to keep it lightweight.
  * **Getting Started Guide:** Add a markdown file with step-by-step instructions for requesting API access, installing dependencies, and running sample code.
* **License:** Add an open-source license (e.g., MIT License) to encourage use and contributions.
* **Version Control:** Commit initial files and push to GitHub. Use a .gitignore file for sensitive data (e.g., API keys).

comments.body: For the Indices, we can open-source draft code for running the historical simulation for a given index using VectorBT - got to modify it though to pull the data from the API instead of the DB

For trading agent:

1. A API where let user fetch history signals
2. A API for user manage their current bots/agents
3. A API allowing users fetch the data of his trading history

@harshg @chao @vasilis what sample scripts that using the TM API can we open-source to developers for the hackathon?

Thinking maybe the trading agents/bot, indices, chatbot, etc.?
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6618). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Sell Index - Build
data.description:
## **Feature: Buy Index on Index Details Page**

### **Overview**

The "sell Index" feature enables users to sell Index directly from the Index Details page using an **embedded wallet** (Token Metrics delegated wallet via Privy). The feature must ensure:

1. Users sell the Index using their **embedded wallet, not their browser wallet**.
2. Users retain at least **$5 in their native chain token** (EVM/Solana) for gas fees.
3. Users see a **breakdown of the tokens in the Index** before sale.
4. The **platform supports only EVM and Solana-based Indexes** due to Privy’s limitations.

[docs.google.com](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AY47Pg1BRPlFqN16AMSMYgbW2PqRRDuHud9FqBDmhS0/edit?usp=sharing)

data.title: Research and Implement Lightweight Library for Charting libraries
data.description:
**Description**:
The current charting library is large, resulting in slower UI performance. We need to reduce the library size to improve responsiveness. Bartosz will investigate lightweight charting solutions and recommend the best option for our project.

**Tasks**:

1. Compare existing lightweight charting libraries for performance, size, and ease of integration.
2. Propose the best solution (library replacement or custom minimal implementation).
3. Document the pros/cons and integration steps for the selected solution.
4. Implement the solution and verify performance improvements.

**Assignee**: Bartosz
**Priority**: High

data.title: Add Chain Symbol Next to Contract Address on Token Details Page
data.description:
#### **Description:**

To improve **clarity and user experience**, we need to display the **chain symbol** next to the contract address on the **Token Details Page**. This will help users quickly identify which blockchain the token is on, especially for multi-chain assets.

#### **Scope of Work:**

**Display chain symbol** (e.g., Ethereum, Solana, BSC, etc.) next to the **contract address**.
Support **multiple chains** if a token exists on more than one network.
Ensure consistency with **existing UI elements** (e.g., similar to how Coingecko displays it).
**Test across different screen sizes** to ensure proper alignment and visibility.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

Chain symbol is **displayed next to the contract address** for all supported tokens.
If a token exists on **multiple chains**, all chains are shown correctly.
 UI remains **clean and intuitive**, without cluttering the contract section.
No impact on **page performance or responsiveness**.

![image (5).png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/02f7a886-0a39-46d7-b2f2-109a39bda9d3/0ccbffeb-0578-4ab4-9e15-325cfe6ff17e)

![image (4).png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/66183eed-8de3-49a8-b695-80d727862345/4d880d8b-aa4e-4c7c-8502-2f28d21a32ab)

data.title: Review data api performance (Anki)
data.description:
Review the data api performance under heavy traffic and make recommendations on how we can improve the response times and reduce failure rate.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Optimize TMAI Trading Engine API Performance Under Heavy Traffic

**Description:**
Evaluate the performance of the TMAI Trading Engine API during high traffic conditions. Identify bottlenecks and provide recommendations to enhance response times and minimize failure rates.

**Business Rationale:**
Ensuring the API remains reliable and efficient under heavy usage is crucial for maintaining user satisfaction and supporting our trading platform's scalability. Improved performance will lead to better user experiences and reduced downtime, directly contributing to business growth and reputation.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Conduct performance testing of the API under simulated heavy traffic scenarios.
2. Identify and document key performance bottlenecks and failure points.
3. Provide actionable recommendations to improve response times and decrease failure rates.
4. Validate proposed solutions with performance metrics showing potential improvements.
5. Obtain approval for implementation of recommended optimizations.

data.title: Emails Going to Spam
data.description:
Users have reported that emails sent from our system are landing in recipients' spam folders instead of their inboxes. This issue affects deliverability and user engagement.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Send an email from our system to a test recipient.
2. Check the recipient's spam/junk folder to verify if the email was misclassified.

**Expected Outcome:**
Emails should be delivered directly to the recipient's inbox.

**Actual Outcome:**
Emails are being flagged as spam and sent to the junk folder.

**Severity:** High

**Assigned Team:** Engineering

**Investigation Areas:**

* Check email authentication settings (SPF, DKIM, DMARC).
* Verify sender reputation and any potential blacklisting.
* Review email content for potential spam triggers.
* Ensure compliance with email best practices (e.g., proper headers, unsubscribe links).
* Analyze logs for email rejection or spam classification patterns.

**Next Steps:**

* Work with IT to update email configurations if needed.
* Implement necessary fixes and test deliverability improvements.
* Monitor email performance and report findings.

comments.body: @ian They were newsletter emails. Last time it was reported was around January.
@val could you please share the emails ending up in spam? Are they the Intercom emails or the newsletters?

data.title: [Group] - Trading Agent V2 Testing
data.description:
## **Title1:** Missing "New Agents" Tab in All Trading Agents Section

**Description:**
The **"New Agents"** tab is missing in the **All Trading Agents** section in the staging environment. This tab is expected to be present based on the **Figma design** and should allow users to view newly added trading agents. The absence of this tab affects the functionality and completeness of the page.

## **Title2:** "Chain" Tab Not Visible After Clicking the Filter Button

**Description:**
After clicking the **Filter button**, the **"Chain"** tab is not visible, which prevents users from applying or selecting different chains for filtering. This issue affects the filtering functionality, causing the user experience to be incomplete.

[https://jam.dev/c/74372630-a71d-4b4d-89bf-17bd97b65696](https://jam.dev/c/74372630-a71d-4b4d-89bf-17bd97b65696)

## **Title3:** "Customize Filter" Section Does Not Match Figma Design

**Description:**
The **"Customize Filter"** section does not align with the **Figma design**. 

[https://jam.dev/c/232924f0-22ee-4e44-9b79-c6988ef9302d](https://jam.dev/c/232924f0-22ee-4e44-9b79-c6988ef9302d)

## **Title4:** "Enter Trading Amount" Placeholder Not Displaying "Enter amount to invest"

**Description:**
In the **Enter Trading Amount** field, the placeholder text is not displaying **"Enter amount to invest"** as expected. This issue affects the clarity of the input field, as users are unable to see the intended instructions on what to input in this field.

[https://jam.dev/c/0622e5d0-e998-478d-b0d3-43aa3e494d55](https://jam.dev/c/0622e5d0-e998-478d-b0d3-43aa3e494d55)

## **Title5:** "Advanced Settings - Custom Period" Placeholder Text and Field Misalignment

**Description:**
In the **Advanced Settings** under **Custom Period**, the **"Enter Trading Amount"** field and its placeholder **"Select End date"** are not aligned with the **Figma design**. Instead of showing "Enter Trading Amount", the field should display **"End Date"**, and the placeholder text should be **"Select End date"** for the date field.

[https://jam.dev/c/0a4db88c-e0c7-44bd-bf3a-a9b245f7173c](https://jam.dev/c/0a4db88c-e0c7-44bd-bf3a-a9b245f7173c)

## **Title6:** Missing Bubble and Grid View Options in All Trading

**Description:**
The **Bubble View** and **Grid View** options are missing from the UI, which affects the ability of users to switch between these two different views. These views are essential for providing users with flexible ways to view the data and should be available for better usability.
