[https://jam.dev/c/0a4db88c-e0c7-44bd-bf3a-a9b245f7173c](https://jam.dev/c/0a4db88c-e0c7-44bd-bf3a-a9b245f7173c)

## **Title6:** Missing Bubble and Grid View Options in All Trading

**Description:**
The **Bubble View** and **Grid View** options are missing from the UI, which affects the ability of users to switch between these two different views. These views are essential for providing users with flexible ways to view the data and should be available for better usability.

data.title: [Group] - Trading Agent V1 Testing
data.description:
## **Title1:** Missing Values in Trading Agent Grade – Only Percentage Symbol Displayed

**Description:**
In the **Trading Agent Grade** section, only the **percentage symbol (%)** is displayed, but no actual values or grades are visible. This prevents users from understanding the performance or grade of the trading agents, as the expected data is missing.

[https://jam.dev/c/94f681af-c3d9-491e-b340-c79beee84bbb](https://jam.dev/c/94f681af-c3d9-491e-b340-c79beee84bbb)

## Title2: "Available Volume" Sort and Filter Icons Positioned Incorrectly

### Description:
In the Available Volume section, the sort and filter icons are not aligned correctly and are placed next to the text. The icons should be positioned in a more consistent and user-friendly way, separate from the text for better visual clarity and accessibility.

[https://jam.dev/c/154fde35-683a-4675-bcbf-eb21c9a6c717](https://jam.dev/c/154fde35-683a-4675-bcbf-eb21c9a6c717)

## Title3: Charts in All Trading Agents Taking More Than 30 Seconds to Load

**Description:**
In the **All Trading Agents** section, the charts are taking more than **30 seconds** to load, significantly affecting the user experience. This delay is causing frustration, as users are unable to access the data quickly.

[https://jam.dev/c/1025661c-fe54-47ca-810a-f2480440560d](https://jam.dev/c/1025661c-fe54-47ca-810a-f2480440560d)

## **Title4:** "Available Volume Less Than" Filter Showing "N/A" and Not Working Correctly

**Description:**
In the **Available Volume** section, when using the **"Less Than"** filter, the result is showing **"N/A"** instead of filtering the data correctly. The filter is not working as expected, preventing users from filtering the **Available Volume** values correctly.

[https://jam.dev/c/68292430-e0d9-4774-9204-9f91a9b6d4dc](https://jam.dev/c/68292430-e0d9-4774-9204-9f91a9b6d4dc)

## **Title5:** All Agent Charts Displaying as Flat for 1M

**Description:**
In the **All Agent** section, all the charts are displaying as flat , meaning that the data is not being visualized correctly. This could be due to incorrect data rendering, scaling issues, or problems with the charting logic, making it impossible for users to interpret the agent performance data.

[https://jam.dev/c/7164742b-30e4-40be-831b-12340f5763eb](https://jam.dev/c/7164742b-30e4-40be-831b-12340f5763eb)

## **Title6:** Channel List Sorting Issue – Random Order Instead of Alphabetical or Count-Based Sorting

**Description:**
In the **Channel List**, the items are displayed in a **random order** instead of being sorted **alphabetically** or based on their **count**. This is causing confusion, as users expect the list to be sorted logically, either alphabetically or by count, to facilitate easier navigation and selection.

[https://jam.dev/c/8a3ebd84-2701-42cb-b9da-bd7dc8070f8f](https://jam.dev/c/8a3ebd84-2701-42cb-b9da-bd7dc8070f8f)

## Title7: Generate Token Metrics Wallet" button Returns an Error

**Description:**
When attempting to use the **"Generate Token Metrics Wallet"** button, an error is returned. This prevents users from generating token metrics or accessing the wallet-related data. 

[https://jam.dev/c/3d166523-dd49-49a5-b443-08a18110dff4](https://jam.dev/c/3d166523-dd49-49a5-b443-08a18110dff4)

## **Title8:** Missing "X" Close Button in "Generate Your Token Metrics Wallet" Popup

**Description:**
In the **"Generate Your Token Metrics Wallet"** popup, there is no **"X"** close button available, which prevents users from easily closing the popup.

[https://jam.dev/c/49e0d0fc-5e5c-44a1-ac6c-0424ca643682](https://jam.dev/c/49e0d0fc-5e5c-44a1-ac6c-0424ca643682)

## **Title9:** Missing Icons for Bubble View

**Description:**
The **Bubble View** does not have an **icon** to switch between views. This missing icon makes it difficult for users to easily switch between **list view** and **grid view**, affecting the overall usability and navigation of the page.

[https://jam.dev/c/73d43ef2-5a3c-422c-b0d3-6dde3e496300](https://jam.dev/c/73d43ef2-5a3c-422c-b0d3-6dde3e496300)

## **Title10:** Clicking on Agent in Grid/Bubble View Does Not Navigate to the Details Page

**Description:**
In the **Grid/Bubble View**, when clicking on an **Agent**, the user is not navigated to the **Details** page as expected. This prevents users from accessing more detailed information about the agent, disrupting the flow and user experience.

[https://jam.dev/c/4075be8f-499e-4ca7-b704-c798879c4cf6](https://jam.dev/c/4075be8f-499e-4ca7-b704-c798879c4cf6) - Then giving 500 error

[https://jam.dev/c/4d61546c-1fd7-41fa-bc5e-81eda4b483c4](https://jam.dev/c/4d61546c-1fd7-41fa-bc5e-81eda4b483c4)

## **Title11:** Exchange Filter Popup Layout Issues – Exchange Not Fixed and Popup Appears Too Large with Single Exchange

**Description:**
In the **Exchange Filter** popup, the displayed **exchange** is not fixed, causing the popup layout to behave inconsistently. Additionally, when only one exchange is available, the popup appears disproportionately large and is centered awkwardly, making the design look unpolished.

[https://jam.dev/c/9f902986-f2a0-477f-8c92-08ca55e847ce](https://jam.dev/c/9f902986-f2a0-477f-8c92-08ca55e847ce)

##

data.title: [Staging-Automation]Ratings Page Fails to Load After 9 Seconds
data.description:
**Description:**
The **Ratings page** occasionally fails to load properly, even after waiting for **9 seconds**. This issue does not occur consistently, but when it does, it prevents users from accessing the page within a reasonable timeframe, leading to a poor user experience.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the **Ratings page**.
2. Observe that, after waiting for **9 seconds**, the page fails to load.
3. Refreshing the page or retrying may resolve the issue, but it occurs intermittently.
4. [https://jam.dev/c/0da12ff3-1e52-48c3-88ae-368759464f34](https://jam.dev/c/0da12ff3-1e52-48c3-88ae-368759464f34)

data.title: [Staging-Automation] Intermittent Delay in Token Search - Results Not Showing After 7 Seconds
data.description:
**Description:**
When performing a **token search**, there are intermittent delays where no results are returned, even after waiting for **7 seconds**. This issue does not happen consistently, but it has been observed occasionally, disrupting the user experience.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the **token search** section.
2. Search for a token (any token).
3. Observe that, occasionally, after waiting for **7 seconds**, no results are returned.
4. Refreshing or retrying the search might eventually return results, but the issue is inconsistent.
5. [https://jam.dev/c/8a426ae7-4809-4749-a6d7-cabbd8d96696](https://jam.dev/c/8a426ae7-4809-4749-a6d7-cabbd8d96696)

data.title: Fix Website & Social Links Behavior on Token Details Page
data.description:
**Description:**

Currently, clicking on **website and social links** on the **Token Details Page** opens them in the **same new tab**, causing users to lose their place. To improve navigation, all external links should open in **separate new tabs**.

#### **Scope of Work:**

* Ensure **each website and social link opens in a separate new tab** instead of reusing the same one.
* Apply this fix consistently across all tokens on the **Token Details Page**.
* Test to confirm the behavior works across **different browsers and devices**.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

✅ Each external link opens in **its own new tab** when clicked.
✅ The fix is applied to **all website and social links** on the Token Details Page.
✅ No impact on page performance or existing functionality.

#### **Reference:**

🔗 [Jam Video of the Issue](https://jam.dev/c/2e2031d2-9471-4ff7-82fc-0a6702a40dfc)

data.title: Astrobot User unable to update email address
data.description:
Wallet Address: \*\*0x3f459d8285be5462fd5e6c0c44295c2a707e12e9

Description: Unable to update email address so that they can join Telegram. 
\*\*
[https://jam.dev/c/49e541be-c584-4929-af8a-2b1edf9a8cac](https://jam.dev/c/49e541be-c584-4929-af8a-2b1edf9a8cac)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enable Astrobot Users to Update Email Addresses

**Description:** Users are currently unable to update their email addresses within the Astrobot platform, preventing them from joining Telegram. This issue affects wallet address: **0x3f459d8285be5462fd5e6c0c44295c2a707e12e9**.

**Business Rationale:** Allowing users to update their email addresses is essential for maintaining accurate contact information and enabling community engagement through platforms like Telegram, thereby enhancing user experience and retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Users can successfully change their email address in their Astrobot account settings.
2. The system validates the new email address format and ensures it is not already in use.
3. A confirmation email is sent to the new address to verify ownership.
4. Users receive a notification upon successful email update.
5. The updated email address is reflected across all associated services, including Telegram integration.

data.title: set up deployed dev containers to be used in other repositories
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Create Dev Containers for Engineering + AI Teams

**Description:**
Establish standardized development containers that are deployed and can be utilized across multiple repositories by the Engineering and AI teams.

**Business Rationale:**
Reducing technical debt by providing consistent development environments will streamline setup processes, minimize environment-related issues, enhance collaboration, and increase overall team productivity and code quality.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Standardized dev container configurations are created and documented.
* Containers are successfully deployed and integrated with all relevant repositories.
* Comprehensive setup instructions are available for both Engineering and AI teams.
* Successful verification and testing by members of both teams.
* Version control is implemented to manage updates and changes to the dev containers.

data.title: Remove BASIC plan from Stripe
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

---

**Issue: Remove BASIC Plan from Stripe**

**Description:**
Eliminate the BASIC subscription plan from our Stripe billing setup to streamline our pricing structure and focus on more profitable offerings.

**Business Rationale:**
The BASIC plan has shown low adoption and minimal revenue generation. Removing it will simplify our product offerings, reduce maintenance efforts, and allow us to allocate resources toward higher-tier plans that better meet customer needs and drive increased revenue.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The BASIC plan is successfully removed from the Stripe dashboard.
2. Users cannot subscribe to the BASIC plan through the application.
3. Existing BASIC subscribers receive notifications and are transitioned to an alternative plan without service interruption.
4. All references to the BASIC plan are deleted from the application interface and related documentation.
5. Comprehensive testing confirms that the removal does not impact other subscription plans or system functionalities.

---

data.title: Account Management - Astrobot
data.description:
1. 0x005E9f8E7dE28bfAf94b74d33fD7fEfe5541f08d - ADVANCED Astrobot - PREMIUM PLAN
2. 0x2Ec859CDa876b8708E8db5A636772748A8724A2f - PREMIUM Astrobot - PREMIUM PLAN

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Refactor Account Management for Astrobot Premium Plan

**Description:**
Address technical debt in the Account Management module for Astrobot’s Premium Plan users, specifically targeting accounts `0x005E9f8E7dE28bfAf94b74d33fD7fEfe5541f08d` (ADVANCED) and `0x2Ec859CDa876b8708E8db5A636772748A8724A2f` (PREMIUM).

**Business Rationale:**
Improving the Account Management system will enhance system reliability, facilitate easier maintenance, and ensure a seamless experience for Premium Plan subscribers, thereby supporting customer satisfaction and retention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Technical debt related to the specified Premium Plan accounts is fully addressed.
* Account Management functionalities for ADVANCED and PREMIUM Astrobot operate correctly without errors.

data.title: Login Redirection Issue Across Multiple Token Metrics Services
data.description:
Users([saithbit30@gmail.com](mailto:saithbit30@gmail.com)) are experiencing an issue when attempting to log into various Token Metrics services, including:

* **Analytics Platform**
* **Trading View Indicator**
* **Crypto Investing Guide Ebook**
* **Data API**
* **Astrobot Society**

Each login attempt redirects the user back to the menu instead of granting access to the intended service.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the login page of any affected service.
2. Enter valid credentials and attempt to log in.
3. Observe that the system redirects back to the menu instead of proceeding to the expected page.

**Expected Behavior:**
Users should be successfully logged into their respective services after entering valid credentials.

**Actual Behavior:**
After login, users are redirected back to the menu, preventing access to the services.

**Attachments:**

[IMG_1958.MOV](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/8b2cdbba-86a8-4c22-864f-0d22c078e4ea/e29aa338-f213-484d-89a9-ddaa821df8ff)

comments.body: ok assigned for urgent fix
@talha that's good, but it's still being A/B tested. We also need it on the existing and current landing page.

[https://token-metrics.webflow.io/dekstop-variant-1](https://token-metrics.webflow.io/dekstop-variant-1)

we have made the changes in the new landing page and it is ready to push
@talha we need to change the home page from "Sign In" and "Sign Up" to just "Trade Now" or "Get Started" since we want to drive people to trading and not sign in right away.
Okay, i will explain this to the user and get his feedback.

@val in the above attached video I see user makes no attempt to login in the first place. He is just clicking Signin button on different service pages that redirect him to ratings page. He should click `Sign in` button on the top right to signin to analytics platform whenever he is on the actual app which is here: [https://app.tokenmetrics.com/](https://app.tokenmetrics.com/) or just give him a direct url to signin page [https://app.tokenmetrics.com/en/signin](https://app.tokenmetrics.com/en/signin)

data.title: Migrate Kubernetes workloads to Digital Ocean with urgency
data.description:
@ian said:

> @divine I applied Token Metrics for Digital Ocean's startup program yesterday and we got accepted!
>
> We've been approved with $25k in free credits with $10k monthly limit. I've sent you an invite. Please work with @jake on migrating the Kubernetes workloads that amount to $10k a month on Digital Ocean.
>
> Please prioritize this with urgency.
>
> cc: @zaiying @peterson

![IMG_9416.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/15e287f7-d65d-4053-9230-a172d7990d89/4acf8dd4-ba2a-4e38-818f-437cd7b3e9b8)

comments.body: Great! Let's connect next week, I'm happy to move our applications ASAP.

This week, we attempted to deploy to the new cluster using FluxCD, as it was previously utilized in our old cluster. However, we encountered numerous challenges related to dependencies and Custom Resource Definitions (CRDs), which complicated the deployment process. After a discussion, the DevOps team decided to transition from FluxCD to ArgoCD to unify our Kubernetes deployment process. We have successfully migrated several applications, including their secrets and configmaps, to the new system. Currently, we are addressing issues such as deployments requiring additional memory in volumes, leading to quota limits, and constraints on node (VM) sizes due to similar quota restrictions in DigitalOcean (and we may need to reach out to them and request an increase in these @ian). Despite these challenges, we have successfully deployed four out of the five major workloads in the data team’s repository; we will need to sync with @jake to test out and finalize. See Subtasks for screenshots on each of the deployments.
@divine great let's move all then
We can move most of our gcp workloads if not all
@ian yes I still need to access the cluster for application deployment.
@divine that's great, thanks. How much of our GCP workloads can we offload to Digital Ocean?
Sorry, thought DevOps would be handling it so canceled the link. @jake do you still need it?

Hi @ian , the current setup on digital ocean is 
a 12 cpu, 24gb mem node pool instance which will cost us about 144 -240 dollars monthly but thats just for one node pool.

Following the call yesterday with Jake & Peterson and reviewing the application architecture; some applications are memory intensive and some are cpu intensive… 
Hence heres the plan and cost estimation

Node pool setup:

1. create node pools for high CPU applications range of 2 nodes

   ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/2d780721-d2fc-4406-a032-f6e6e10d7bb1/4222c6ed-1129-4c3b-b04b-a733fa4c402e)

   ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/d0417a4c-1eae-4879-963e-08831e181f0b/e52ae819-1f2f-4f28-beaf-bacb6df4777e)
2. create node pools for high MEM applications range of 2 nodes

![Screenshot 2025-03-06 at 18.03.47.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/cc44915e-47bf-44d4-a9a9-5935031db75e/dfc56fc2-66c2-49d2-8d6c-3941c37de124)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/13cfcc1f-4880-4812-a887-ca972fc65d56/34825a78-e289-4e48-9d1a-9bbbae7d1821)

3. One for general purpose, which is the one we have already setup

   ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/bc02841f-d83f-4beb-9d24-43553ac698ec/ba74cde2-8a90-4a67-a247-3fec0e3d6515)

Why this works for us?
Node affinity would be setup on the applications to make sure that they are deployed on the specific nodes that suit the applications use case, this also helps us monitor costs and application resource usage.

This will cost us $576 monthly on compute power compared to what we currently have

This is the plan that is currently in progress starting with the general purpose node pool, and we can plan to upgrade or downgrade as we go

Note: we currently have just 10 droplets (instances) available on our project, pending how this goes we will request an increase

cc: @peterson @jake

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/13ab1a1e-be86-4207-8986-cca71c0fb127/40a5fa21-2a0b-47f5-992f-e23963e7da1e)

The same set up in GCP will charge us around $450 @ian.
@divine how does the pricing compare to GCP?
@ian it seems the invitation link was expired or something, it shows me error when I hit accept from the email. Can you please check? Thank you.

Hey @ian we had a call today and I and @divine would be handling the infra as well as the migration; we would make sure to put all processes in mind whilst doing so and have @jake take a look when ready
@jake sent invite. Please have @peterson and @divine review anything deployed to make sure it’s properly optimized, thanks.

cluster has been created - 
3 nodes - scale up to 5 
will create tickets for next steps as sub tasks

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/c23c40bd-9b3a-4c1b-8eeb-692711c3cbbf/297b0a39-4102-46e2-ae14-03298c540b71)
@ian can you invite me to access? Thanks.
Awesome ! Will work on this

data.title: [Group] - Account Management Testing Bugs
data.description:
## Title1: "Current Password Incorrect" Error Displaying as Success with Green Color

**Description:**
When entering an incorrect **current password** in the relevant form, the system displays a **"Success"** message in green, which can confuse users. A failure message should be shown instead, indicating that the password entered is incorrect.

[https://jam.dev/c/9efdccae-ed8b-4479-8eb8-b7e1126d1abe](https://jam.dev/c/9efdccae-ed8b-4479-8eb8-b7e1126d1abe)

## Title2: Avatar Photo Not Displaying in Profile After Upload

**Description:**
After uploading an avatar photo, the image does not appear in the **profile section**. This issue prevents the user’s avatar from being visible on their profile, even though the upload process completes successfully.

[https://jam.dev/c/16dbdd76-2d36-4007-9f5f-1caf5b05ede6](https://jam.dev/c/16dbdd76-2d36-4007-9f5f-1caf5b05ede6)

## Title3: Missing Billing History Section

**Description:**
The **Billing History** section is missing from the user account, preventing users from viewing their past billing transactions and related details. This section is important for users to track their payment history and manage their billing information.

[https://jam.dev/c/9076149d-1f5f-43f6-a45c-d838b554925a](https://jam.dev/c/9076149d-1f5f-43f6-a45c-d838b554925a)

data.title: TMAI Staking Error
data.description:
* **User**: israr93@live.com
* **Wallet Address**: 0xec5b75E3e9a580D64E7A5241Fe37Be0284c432Bd
* **Issue Summary**: User encounters an error when attempting to stake TMAI tokens.
* **Steps to Reproduce**:
  1. Navigate to the TMAI staking platform.
  2. Connect wallet (specific wallet not mentioned).
  3. Enter desired TMAI amount for staking.
  4. Initiate staking transaction.
* **Expected Outcome**: Successful staking of TMAI tokens.
* **Actual Outcome**: An unspecified error message appears, preventing the staking process.
* **Additional Information**:
  * **Possible Causes**:
    * Compatibility issues with the user's wallet or browser.
    * Network connectivity problems.
    * Smart contract or platform-related errors.
  * **User's Environment**:
    * Wallet: Not specified.
    * Browser: Not specified.
    * Operating System: Not specified.
* **Recommendations**:
  1. **User Actions**:
     * Ensure the wallet and browser are up-to-date.
     * Try using a different browser or wallet.
     * Check for stable internet connectivity.
  2. **Development Team Actions**:
     * Investigate server logs for error patterns related to staking.
     * Test the staking process across various wallets and browsers to identify compatibility issues.
     * Review recent updates or changes to the staking platform that might have introduced new bugs.
* **Attachments**: 

  [STAKING_ERROR.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/ef792850-5417-4cd0-9e95-a99cfcc09de0/9653196b-c128-4a33-b492-6c9208d0dacc)
* **Priority**: High – Staking is a core functionality, and errors can hinder user engagement and trust.

data.title: Use Hourly Price data for 1W timeframe
data.description:
This ticket is about updating the Data API [endpoint](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/reference/token-details-price-charts) that creates a chart. The 1W chart should use **hourly** price data instead of daily.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/3154b7f9-ca21-41e2-8062-01621ebe90a6/05069dd0-856d-4a50-9bde-8ef3f329e11c)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Use Hourly Price Data for 1W Timeframe in Data API

**Description:**
Update the Data API [endpoint](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/reference/token-details-price-charts) to utilize **hourly** price data instead of daily data for generating 1-week (1W) timeframe charts.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the 1W charts with hourly data will provide users with more granular insights, improving the accuracy of price trend analysis and supporting better-informed decision-making.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The 1W chart displays price data at hourly intervals.
* The Data API endpoint retrieves and processes hourly data for the 1W timeframe correctly.
* Existing charts for other timeframes (e.g., daily, monthly) remain unaffected and continue using their respective data intervals.
* All changes are validated through testing to ensure accuracy and performance.
* Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the use of hourly data for the 1W timeframe.

data.title: Incorrect Price on a Token
data.description:
Followed up with the user regarding the incorrect price of a token. They mentioned that it is still incorrect.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Incorrect Price Display on Token

**Description:**

**Description:**
The price displayed for the specified token is currently incorrect, leading to user confusion and potential transaction errors. Despite previous attempts to resolve this issue, the incorrect pricing persists.

**Business Rationale:**
Accurate token pricing is essential for maintaining user trust and ensuring reliable transactions. Incorrect prices can result in financial discrepancies, diminished user confidence, and potential loss of revenue.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The token price accurately reflects real-time market data.
* Price updates are consistently and correctly displayed across all platforms.
* Verification is completed through unit and integration testing to ensure accuracy.
* Users no longer report discrepancies related to the token price.

data.title: Issues with Configuring a Discord Notification Channel
data.description:
The user is encountering an issue while setting up their Discord Channel for automated notifications.

Wallet Address: 0xe8cea9bbb495085805ef200691c4ee6b17b7617d

[Settings - Token Metrics - Google Chrome 2025-02-27 15-53-24.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/0a10b0e5-7aa4-4cf1-b334-d87cf5838b64/24ce63ec-3b30-4024-8593-4543aa5cc283)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Fix Configuration Issues for Discord Notification Channel

**Description:**
Users are experiencing problems when setting up Discord Channels for automated notifications. Specifically, attempts to integrate Discord with the notification system fail, preventing notifications from being sent to the designated Discord channel.

**Business Rationale:**
Reliable Discord notifications are essential for keeping our community informed and engaged in real-time. Addressing these configuration issues will enhance user satisfaction, improve communication efficiency, and support the growth of our Discord community.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Users can successfully connect and authenticate their Discord account with the notification system.
* Automated notifications are delivered to the specified Discord channel without errors.
* Documentation or guidance is provided to assist users in the configuration process.
* The solution is tested and verified across multiple Discord servers and user environments.

**Title:** Supabase Integration for Trading AI Agents

**Description:**  
Update all trading agent queries to comply with Supabase's new query format to ensure seamless functionality and integration with Privy/Fiat Gateways. This update will address existing technical debt, enhance system maintainability, and support the scalability of V1 Trading AI Agents.

**Business Rationale:**  
Adopting Supabase's updated query format will improve system reliability, reduce maintenance efforts, and facilitate future enhancements. This alignment is crucial for maintaining competitive performance and supporting the growth of our AI-driven trading infrastructure.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All trading agent queries are updated to the latest Supabase query format.
* Comprehensive testing confirms that all functionalities operate correctly post-update.
* No regressions are introduced in the V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy/Fiat Gateways.
* Documentation is revised to reflect the updated query structures and usage.

data.title: Implement DAG-Based Proposal Synchronization for DAO Platform
data.description:
Develop a DAG process that automatically syncs proposal data and their statuses from the smart contract to the database. This synchronization is critical for ensuring that the governance DAO platform displays up-to-date information on proposals.

**Key Requirements:**

* **Data Sync:**
  * Retrieve proposals and their statuses directly from the smart contract.
  * Update the platform's database with the retrieved data.
* **Scheduling:**
  * Configure the DAG to run every 12 hours to perform the sync.
  * Evaluate if a 12-hour interval is sufficient; consider adjustments if necessary.
* **Monitoring & Logging:**
  * Implement logging for successful updates and error tracking.
  * Provide alerts or notifications in case of sync failures.
* **Documentation:**
  * Document the process, including configuration details and any decisions regarding the sync frequency.

**Notes:**
This task is based on a team discussion where the decision was made to use the DAG option for updating the database from the smart contract. Additionally, the team raised a concern about whether a 12-hour sync frequency might be too infrequent, which should be reviewed during implementation.

**Key Requirements:**

* Optimize the rendering logic and minimize unnecessary updates
* Ensure that data updates smoothly without causing lag or freezing the user interface

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Integrate Real-Time Events with Chart Components

**Description:**
Connect incoming real-time events to the chart components to enable dynamic data visualization. Optimize rendering logic to minimize unnecessary updates and ensure smooth data transitions without causing UI lag or freezes.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing real-time data visualization improves user experience by providing timely and responsive insights, thereby increasing user engagement and satisfaction with the application.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Real-time events are successfully received and displayed on chart components without manual refresh.
* Rendering logic reduces unnecessary re-renders by at least 30%.
* Data updates on charts occur smoothly without any noticeable lag or UI freezing.
* Performance is validated under typical and peak data loads.

data.title: Backend Task: Trading Agents Listing - Tab Filters Implementation
data.description:
#### **Objective**

Implement backend support for the **Popular**, **Top Performing**, and **Favorites** filters on the **Trading Agents Listing Page**.

[TMAI_task (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=8778-73005&t=vypgLFk1auCdT58E-0)

#### **Requirements**

1. **Popular Sorting**
   * Rank Trading Agents by **Total AUM (Assets Under Management)** in **descending order**.
   * The higher the AUM, the more popular the agent.
2. **Top Performing Sorting**
   * Rank Trading Agents by **1M (1-month) performance returns** in **descending order**.
   * Focus on highlighting recent performance.
3. **Favorites Implementation**
   * Replicate the existing **Favorites system** from the Ratings page.
   * Users should be able to mark/unmark Trading Agents as favorites using a **star icon button**.
   * Include a **Favorites section** displaying only user-selected agents.

#### **Deliverables**

* **Backend logic** to support sorting for **Popular** and **Top Performing** tabs.
* **Favorites system** identical to the one on the Ratings page.
* **API endpoints** to fetch Trading Agents based on selected filters.
* **Favorite/unfavorite action** allowing users to manage their favorites.

#### **Expected Outcome**

Users can seamlessly sort Trading Agents based on popularity and performance, while also managing a personalized list of favorites.

parent.title: Trading Agent V2 Design - Agent Listing Page (List View) & Files Separation

comments.body: @ben The age of the agent depends on when the token has started trading really. Given that the agents' premise is to automate the trading on the underlying token using our grades, we can potentially offer new agents when/if we start producing real-time grades (I have a ticket on that [AI-4160](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/AI-4160/create-real-time-grades)). For now though, the age of the agent is nothing more than the agent of the underlying token (i.e. since when the token has started trading).
wait @ben, we need logic to display the column and its order when the user hides or reorders through the customization feature

2. **Top Performing Sorting**

data.title: Trading Agent V2 Design - Agent Listing Page (List View) & Files Separation
data.description:
[Trading agent revamp (Ben) - TMAI_task (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=8778-73005&t=dIa8WtnucWEdvUVN-4)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Front End Implementation of Trading Agent V2 - Agent Listing Page (List View)

**Description:**
Develop the front-end for the Trading Agent V2's Agent Listing Page in List View, based on the Figma design [here](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=8778-73005&t=dIa8WtnucWEdvUVN-4). This page will display all V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy and Fiat gateways, allowing users to view and manage their trading agents efficiently.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the Agent Listing Page with the V2 design will improve user experience by providing a more intuitive and streamlined interface. Integrating Privy and Fiat gateways supports broader payment options, catering to a wider user base and increasing platform usability and adoption.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Design Implementation:** The Agent Listing Page matches the provided Figma design in layout, styling, and responsiveness across major browsers and devices.
2. **Agent Display:** All V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy and Fiat gateways are listed with accurate details, including agent name, status, and gateway type.
3. **Interactivity:** Users can perform essential actions such as viewing agent details, editing settings, and deleting agents directly from the list view.
4. **Performance:** The page loads within acceptable timeframes and handles data efficiently without lag.
5. **Accessibility:** The page adheres to accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG 2.1), ensuring it is usable by all users.
6. **Testing:** Comprehensive front-end tests are written and pass, covering key functionalities and UI components.

Title: Trading Agent V2 Design - Agent Listing Page (List View) & Files Separation

Description:
[Trading agent revamp (Ben) - TMAI_task (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=8778-73005&t=dIa8WtnucWEdvUVN-4)

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Front End Implementation of Trading Agent V2 - Agent Listing Page (List View)

**Description:**
Develop the front-end for the Trading Agent V2's Agent Listing Page in List View, based on the Figma design [here](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=8778-73005&t=dIa8WtnucWEdvUVN-4). This page will display all V1 Trading AI Agents integrated with Privy and Fiat gateways, allowing users to view and manage their trading agents efficiently.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the Agent Listing Page with the V2 design will improve user experience by providing a more intuitive and streamlined interface. Integrating Privy and Fiat gateways supports broader payment options, catering to a wider user base and increasing platform usability and adoption.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Design Implementation:** The Agent Listing Page matches the provided Figma design in layout, styling, and responsiveness across major browsers and devices.
2. **Agent Display:** All V1 Trading AI Agents with Privy and Fiat gateways are listed with accurate details, including agent name, status, and gateway type.
3. **Interactivity:** Users can perform essential actions such as viewing agent details, editing settings, and deleting agents directly from the list view.
4. **Performance:** The page loads within acceptable timeframes and handles data efficiently without lag.
5. **Accessibility:** The page adheres to accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG 2.1), ensuring it is usable by all users.
6. **Testing:** Comprehensive front-end tests are written and pass, covering key functionalities and UI components.

data.title: Bug - Delayed Account Upgrade After TMAI Payment
data.description:
**Summary:**
After making a **payment with TMAI** for an account upgrade, the **subscription does not immediately update** to **Premium** or **Advanced**. Users need to **wait for some time** before the correct package information is reflected in their account.

[https://jam.dev/c/db1883b9-3201-4c97-8b83-9c948105f3fd](https://jam.dev/c/db1883b9-3201-4c97-8b83-9c948105f3fd)

### **Expected Result:**

* After a **successful TMAI payment**, the account should **immediately** upgrade to **Premium** or **Advanced**.
* The **subscription details should be updated in real-time** without delay.

comments.body:
This is related to TMAI
@suleman assigning it to you
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/5832). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Mobile(Parent): Setup and Implement dark mode
data.description:
---

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/06c8b8ee-599a-4ec5-8a5a-d1a3f424456b/aa0f91fa-d52b-4b02-af52-85b3dc3751d2)

**Title:** Implement Dark Mode for Mobile Application

**Description:**
Add a dark mode feature to the mobile app, allowing users to switch between light and dark themes to enhance usability in low-light environments and reduce eye strain.

**Business Rationale:**
Offering dark mode meets user demand for customizable interfaces, improves accessibility, and aligns with current design trends. This feature can increase user satisfaction and engagement, potentially boosting app retention rates.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A toggle for switching between light and dark modes is available in the app settings.
* Dark mode is consistently applied across all screens and UI components.
* Color schemes in dark mode meet accessibility standards for contrast and readability.
* User’s theme preference is saved and persists across app launches.
* Dark mode operates smoothly on all supported mobile devices and operating systems without performance issues.
* No existing functionality is negatively impacted by the introduction of dark mode.

---

data.title: [Group-Staging] Token Alerts Page Bugs
data.description:
## **Title3:** Slack and Email Notifications Not Received After Successful Configuration

**Description:**  
Despite successfully configuring Slack and Email notifications, no notifications are being sent or received. This issue affects both communication channels, preventing users from staying informed about important updates.

data.title: Investigate and Refactor Token Details Page
data.description:
**Description:**
Investigate the issues reported by Ozcan related to the Token Details page and implement necessary fixes. Since the page has not been worked on yet by Anki, the task will involve a thorough review of the codebase, identifying potential areas for improvement, and performing necessary refactoring.

**Steps to Complete:**

1. **Initial Investigation:**
   * Review the reported issues to understand their root causes.
   * Analyze current implementation and identify problem areas.
2. **Sync with Romes:**
   * Coordinate with Romes, who originally built the page, for insights and clarification.
   * Coordinate with Suleman also
3. **Code Refactoring Plan:**
   * Outline areas requiring refactoring and propose changes for code improvement.
   * Ensure any modifications align with the overall architecture and standards.
4. **Implementation:**
   * Refactor the Token Details page based on findings and plan.
   * Address identified issues and implement necessary fixes.
5. **Testing:**
   * Conduct thorough testing to ensure the page functions correctly after changes.
   * Collaborate with QA to validate the fixes.
6. **Deployment Preparation:**
   * Document changes and ensure they are ready for deployment in the next cycle.

data.title: Peer Review (Trading Agent into TMAI Agent) - Suleman
data.description:
For major projects, **every developer** should participate in a comprehensive, end-to-end review. While GitHub peer reviews are valuable, they often focus on smaller code segments. This expanded process involves:

1. **Full-Project Audits**: Each developer examines the entire codebase, not just isolated PRs.
2. **Hands-On Testing**: Reviewers clone the repository, run the project in a **staging environment**, and actively **test functionality** to identify hidden issues.
3. **Cross-Team Involvement**: Team members outside the immediate project also join in, providing fresh perspectives and “tearing it apart” to find potential weaknesses.
4. **Knowledge Sharing**: As everyone reviews the code, they gain a deeper understanding of the project’s architecture and dependencies, strengthening overall team expertise.
5. **Mandatory Checkpoint**: Before release, ensure that each developer’s feedback has been addressed, documented, and signed off in **Linear** or the relevant project management tool.

Implementing this **full-project peer review** ensures higher code quality, reduces bugs in production, and encourages a culture of shared ownership and continuous learning.

data.title: Investigation and Solution Implementation for $TMAI Payment Confirmation Issue
data.description:
### **Background**

The current payment confirmation method involves users sending requests from the frontend after completing their payment. This approach has proven to be unreliable, as evidenced by a recent issue where a user did not receive Premium access despite their payment being confirmed.

The lead engineer suspects multiple potential causes, including network issues on the user's side, temporary downtime on the platform, or limitations in the current manual request approach. Additionally, the team acknowledges that moving to a webhook-based system would provide a more robust solution.

Slack Chat here: [https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/archives/C07TQH2UCAV/p1735561157456169](https://token-metrics-group.slack.com/archives/C07TQH2UCAV/p1735561157456169)

---

### **Investigation**

1. **Review Logs**
   * Examine server logs and payment logs for the specific user on the mentioned date to identify the root cause of the issue.
   * Look for any network errors, timeout issues, or platform downtimes that might have affected the payment confirmation process.
2. **Analyze the Current Workflow**
   * Map out the end-to-end flow of the current payment confirmation process.
   * Identify weaknesses or bottlenecks, especially in scenarios involving user-side network issues or server downtime.
3. **Feasibility of Webhook Implementation**
   * Investigate why a webhook-based approach was deemed "not possible" during the initial implementation.
   * Review current contracts or systems to determine if webhook endpoints can now be integrated.
4. **Benchmarking**
   * Research and document industry standards for payment confirmation, particularly how leading platforms handle this process.

---

### **Implementation**

1. **Develop Webhook-Based Confirmation**
   * Design and implement a webhook system where payment confirmation is handled server-side.
   * Ensure that payment gateways or smart contracts trigger the webhook to send payment status directly to the backend.
2. **Test for Reliability**
   * Conduct thorough testing to simulate various user scenarios, including network instability and system downtime.
   * Implement redundancy measures to handle webhook retries in case of failures.
3. **Graceful Transition**
   * Implement the new system in parallel with the existing method initially.
   * Migrate users to the new system after ensuring stability.
4. **Documentation and Monitoring**
   * Document the new process in detail for future reference.
   * Set up real-time monitoring and alerting systems to track payment confirmation and quickly identify anomalies.

---

### **Outcome**

This task will result in a more reliable and automated payment confirmation system, significantly reducing the likelihood of users not receiving their premium access due to technical issues.

data.title: Refine Redis Caching (L2 Cache) for All Products/Pages
data.description:
**Estimate (with Cursor AI):** \~4 hours

**Objective:**
Optimize Redis TTLs and key naming so that commonly accessed data (e.g., top traded tokens, frequently viewed market stats, common Chatbot responses) is served from cache quickly.

**Exact Steps:**

1. Ask Cursor AI to propose a standardized naming pattern and TTL values for keys.
2. Update code to apply these TTLs and naming conventions across all major endpoints.
3. Validate on staging that Redis hit ratio improves.

**Success Criteria:**

* At least a 10% improvement in Redis hit ratio across critical endpoints (Trading Bot, Market Page, etc.).
* No stale or incorrect data issues (check Sentry).
* Jam Dev video: Show code changes and metrics for improved cache hits.

data.title: Immediate API Performance Improvements (Parent)
data.description:
**Objective:**
Implement and verify a set of quick optimizations to our Next.js and backend services that will reduce API latency across all Token Metrics products/pages—Trading Bot, Chatbot/TMAI Agent, Indices, Market Page, Ratings, Token Details, Research—improving real-time analytics responsiveness, user satisfaction, and retention.

**Business Value:**
By delivering faster responses across the entire platform, users enjoy a more seamless experience when interacting with critical features. This leads to better decision-making, higher trust in our product, and increased likelihood of subscription renewals and upgrades.

**Tools & Resources:**

* Next.js Docs: https://nextjs.org/docs
* Compression Middleware: [https://www.npmjs.com/package/compression](https://www.npmjs.com/package/compression)
* Redis Docs: https://redis.io/docs/
* Prometheus & Grafana: Internal documentation
* Sentry: https://docs.sentry.io/
* Promise.all: [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise/all](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise/all)
* Jam Dev: [https://jam.dev/](https://jam.dev/)
* Cursor AI: [https://cursor.sh/](https://cursor.sh/) (internal guidance for usage)

**Cursor AI Involvement:**
Cursor AI will assist with boilerplate code, refactoring repetitive tasks, and generating initial configuration snippets. Developers remain responsible for reviewing and testing the code.

**Recording Requirement:**
After each sub-issue, record a short Jam Dev video (1-3 minutes) demonstrating successful completion and improvements.

**Overall Success Goals:**

* Achieve 20-30% latency reduction on key endpoints for all major products/pages.
* No increase in errors in Sentry.

**Note on Estimates:**
Estimates reflect Cursor AI assistance. Actual time may vary, but the goal is to keep each task under 7 hours.

By following these tasks, the team ensures immediate performance gains across the Token Metrics platform, setting a strong performance baseline for future architectural shifts.

data.title: Markets Page indexing
data.description:
### **Detailed Description:**

Conduct an in-depth investigation of all queries used for the assigned page to identify potential performance bottlenecks. Determine which columns in which tables should be indexed to enhance query efficiency and provide these recommendations to the data team for implementation.

---

### **Steps:**

1. **Query Analysis:**
   * Collect all queries executed on the assigned page, including those used for data fetching, filtering, and sorting.
   * Identify frequently executed queries and queries with noticeable performance delays.
2. **Identify Columns for Indexing:**
   * Break down each query into its components (e.g., SELECT, WHERE, GROUP BY, ORDER BY).
   * Analyze the columns involved in:
     * **Search/Filter Operations**: Columns used in WHERE clauses.
     * **Sorting**: Columns in ORDER BY clauses.
     * **Joins**: Columns used in JOIN operations.
   * Determine if these columns are already indexed or if additional indexes are required.
3. **Performance Testing:**
   * Simulate query execution to measure current performance metrics (e.g., execution time, rows scanned).
   * Compare performance with and without hypothetical indexing to estimate potential improvements.
4. **Recommendations:**
   * Compile a list of recommended columns and tables for indexing.
   * Include:
     * Table names
     * Column names
     * Justification for indexing (e.g., high usage frequency, reducing scan time)
   * Highlight any trade-offs, such as increased storage or index maintenance overhead.
5. **Collaboration with Data Team:**
   * Share the indexing recommendations with the data team.
   * Work with them to prioritize indexing based on performance impact and database constraints.
6. **Documentation:**
   * Create a report detailing the analysis process, testing results, and recommended indexes.
   * Include examples of queries optimized by the suggested indexes.

---

### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* A comprehensive analysis of all queries on the assigned page is completed.
* Key columns and tables requiring indexing are identified and documented.
* Recommendations are provided to the data team, with justifications for each index.
* Performance improvements are validated through testing.

data.title: (Parent) Backend Pagespeed Improvement (2nd week)
data.description:
Token Metrics is experiencing performance issues, as indicated by recent PageSpeed Insights reports. 

Key performance metrics such as Time to First Byte (TTFB), First Contentful Paint (FCP), Largest Contentful Paint (LCP), and Total Blocking Time (TBT) are below optimal thresholds. This issue aims to address these bottlenecks by outlining actionable tasks for the development team.

Current Performance Metrics:

```
•	Time to First Byte (TTFB): 1.5s (Goal: < 600ms)

•	First Contentful Paint (FCP): 9.3s (Goal: < 2.5s)

•	Largest Contentful Paint (LCP): 9.6s (Goal: < 2.5s)

•	Total Blocking Time (TBT): 1,470ms (Goal: < 300ms)
```

Start first optimizing the highest opportunity pages according to Sentry below.

[https://tokenmetrics-30.sentry.io/performance/?environment=production&statsPeriod=90d](https://tokenmetrics-30.sentry.io/performance/?environment=production&statsPeriod=90d)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/06c792c0-a832-4358-9499-01fc15814ad0/7d9f0df5-07a8-440a-bb60-a7a560ebd961)

Acceptance Criteria

```
•	Performance Goals Met:

•	TTFB is under 600ms.

•	FCP and LCP are under 2.5s.

•	TBT is under 300ms.

•	Functionality Unaffected:

•	All existing features work as before.

•	No new bugs or regressions introduced.

•	Code Quality Maintained:

•	All changes are reviewed and approved.

•	Code adheres to existing style guidelines.

•	Testing Completed:

•	All unit and integration tests pass.

•	New tests added for any new functionality.

•	Monitoring in Place:

•	Performance monitoring tools are active.

•	Alerts configured for performance regressions.
```

data.title: Application Code Updates (Next.js + Prisma)
data.description:
**Objective:**
Refactor the application code (Next.js) to query OLTP data via Prisma (Supabase) instead of Snowflake. Keep Snowflake queries for OLAP tasks only.

**Description:**

* Find and replace Snowflake OLTP queries with Prisma queries against Supabase.
* Implement Redis caching for frequently accessed data.
* (Optional) Consider edge deployments (e.g., Vercel) for lower latency globally.

**Execution Steps (with Cursor AI):**

1. Have Cursor AI:
   * Provide code snippets to replace Snowflake queries with Prisma queries.
   * Suggest caching logic using Redis.
   * Propose edge configuration if needed.
2. If Cursor AI fails:
   * Manually refactor queries and add caching logic.

**Success Criteria:**

* All OLTP queries now use Prisma (Supabase).
* Redis caching reduces load times for hot endpoints.
* Application runs without OLTP dependency on Snowflake.

Initial steps: (cc @ian @suleman @jake)
[https://www.prisma.io/docs/getting-started/setup-prisma/add-to-existing-project/relational-databases-typescript-postgresql](https://www.prisma.io/docs/getting-started/setup-prisma/add-to-existing-project/relational-databases-typescript-postgresql)

* `npm install prisma --save-dev`
* `npx prisma init`
* Update .env add DATABASE_URL (@jake will give the URL)
* `npx prisma db pull`
* `npm install @prisma/client `
  * `touch src/lib/prisma.ts`
  * [https://github.com/prisma/prisma-examples/blob/latest/orm/nextjs-api-routes/src/lib/prisma.ts](https://github.com/prisma/prisma-examples/blob/latest/orm/nextjs-api-routes/src/lib/prisma.ts)

comments.body: @suleman @ankit @harshg what's the status on the sub issues for this? Are they blocked?
Yes @sam, I and @andrew will spend some times over the weekend with the expect that Engineering team can start doing migration on Monday.
Thanks for the in depth update here Jake. So we can expect by next cycle on Monday Suleman will be ready to take this ticket.

@sam We are currently working on this and have migrated all the data to Supabase. However, Prisma requires a unique identifier key for each table, which was not present in some tables previously stored in Snowflake. The keys for tables used by the engineering team should ideally be defined by them, as these tables are ultimately used and managed by them.

We understand that many of these tables were originally created and designed by former engineers, and the current team has primarily been using them without focusing on their design. To address this, we are working to adapt these tables to meet Prisma's requirements so the team can start coding as soon as possible.

This process involves more manual effort than simply copying data from Snowflake to Supabase. The additional requirements from Prisma have caused some delays, but we aim to finalize the necessary changes and define all tables by the end of this week.
cc @ian

@ian [DAT-2999](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/DAT-2999/code-migration-issues) This ticket is blocking these tickets for Engineering to take this up this cycle. If this is resolved today the engineering team will take one or two tasks here in this parent ticket. The rest will have to be moved back to next cycle.
I already noted on the ticket that we need to closely work with the data team to check for any issues during migration

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/eb6c4b11-58e5-448f-82e7-f8336dcfa86a/76e87df3-a029-43cd-b9e8-167ba19f9110)
Thanks a lot, I and Andrew are always here to support.

I will put the document here, please wait

cc @jake @ian @suleman

@ian as I discussed with engineering team that they want to migrate their codes to ORM models, so we can support them on creating tables/ views while the codes are 100% nextJS representing data models in database which I believe they can do by their own.

Please correct me if I'm wrong @ankit

@sam @ben moving these items to this week.

@jake @suleman any guides or docs for the engineering team on how to update queries?
Please let us know what you'll need @ankit @suleman , we will prioritize and support until the code migration completes.
@suleman please make this your priority this week if done with e2b tasks
We have a few more works to complete, but I think they can start working on it @ian .
@jake @andrew is this ready for the engineering team to work on? Please advise if any changes are needed

data.title: Database Architecture Update & Migration (Snowflake OLAP + Supabase OLTP with Prisma)
data.description:
**High-Level Objective:**
Migrate our OLTP workloads from Snowflake to Supabase Postgres using Prisma ORM, while keeping Snowflake dedicated to OLAP. By separating transactional and analytical queries, we aim to reduce latency, improve scalability, enhance developer velocity, and set the stage for future architectural improvements. This serves as an intermediary step before considering potential long-term migrations to ClickHouse or StarRocks.

**Context & Business Value:**
Token Metrics currently relies on Snowflake for both OLTP and OLAP, causing latency and performance bottlenecks for user-facing queries. Moving OLTP to Supabase Postgres and integrating Prisma will deliver faster response times for critical, real-time data queries. Users benefit from quicker insights, improving their trading decisions and overall satisfaction. Faster queries also differentiate Token Metrics from competitors and reduce costs over time.

**Key Points & Clarifications:**

* We already have a Supabase account and can create or use a dedicated project/database for OLTP workloads.
* Prisma needs a target database to manage the schema, so we will set up Prisma with Supabase first, then migrate data from Snowflake into the newly prepared schema.
* Cursor AI should be used as a first resort for each step. If Cursor AI can’t complete a task, give it feedback and try again. Only if it still fails should we proceed manually.

**Considerations:**

* Cursor AI first approach at every step.
* Redis caching, PgBouncer, and edge deployments are optional optimizations depending on complexity and time.
* This interim state improves performance before any potential future migration to ClickHouse or StarRocks.

**Success Criteria for Overall Project:**

* OLTP fully migrated and served by Supabase + Prisma.
* Snowflake reserved for OLAP without latency impacting user-facing queries.
* Verified performance improvements (reduced latency, stable load performance).
* Clear path established for scaling to 10+ million users.

data.title: Backend Optimization
data.description:
## 1\. Optimize API routes

1. List all current API routes and their sizes.
2. Group API routes by functionality.
3. For each group:

   a. Identify common functionalities that can be combined.

   b. Refactor to create a single API route handling multiple related operations.
4. Implement API route segmentation for larger handlers.
5. Convert suitable API routes to Edge API Routes:

   a. Identify routes that don't require Node.js-specific features or npm packages incompatible with Edge Runtime.

   b. Refactor these routes to use Edge Runtime:
   * Move the file to `/pages/api` directory if not already there.
   * Export a default function with the `config` object specifying Edge Runtime:

     ```javascript
     export const config = {
       runtime: 'edge',
     };
     ```
   * Ensure the route only uses Web APIs available in Edge Runtime.
   * Update any database queries or external service calls to be compatible with Edge Runtime.

   c. Test thoroughly to ensure functionality is maintained.

   d. Measure latency improvements, especially for geographically distant users.
6. Implement proper error handling and rate limiting for all API routes.
7. Measure and document the size reduction and performance improvement for each optimized route.

## 2\. Review and optimize middleware

1. Analyze the current middleware implementation.
2. List all functionalities handled by the middleware.
3. Identify any redundant or unnecessary checks.
4. Split middleware into smaller, focused functions.
5. Implement conditional middleware execution based on the route.
6. Use efficient data structures (e.g., Set instead of Array for lookups).
7. Consider moving appropriate middleware to Edge Middleware for improved performance:

   a. Identify middleware that doesn't require Node.js-specific features.

   b. Refactor to use Edge Runtime compatible code.

   c. Test thoroughly to ensure functionality is maintained.
8. Measure the middleware size and execution time before and after optimization.

## 3\. Review and optimize data fetching

1. Audit all data fetching methods in the application.
2. For client-side data fetching:

   a. Implement SWR or React Query for all suitable data fetches.

   b. Set up proper caching strategies for each fetch.

   c. Implement error boundaries for fetch failures.

   d. Use optimistic updates where appropriate to improve perceived performance.
3. For server-side data fetching:

   a. Review all uses of getServerSideProps and getStaticProps.

   b. Implement Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) where appropriate:
   * Identify pages with data that changes infrequently.
   * Set up revalidation periods tailored to each page's data freshness requirements.

   c. Use getStaticProps with fallback for dynamic pages where possible:
   * Implement for pages with a large number of dynamic routes.
   * Ensure proper loading states for fallback pages.
4. Implement data prefetching for critical resources:

   a. Use `next/link` with `prefetch` prop for important page navigations.

   b. Implement custom prefetching for crucial API data.
5. Leverage Next.js 13 app directory and React Server Components where beneficial:

   a. Identify components that can be converted to Server Components.

   b. Refactor data fetching to occur on the server where possible.

   c. Implement streaming for improved loading performance.
6. Optimize database queries:

   a. Review and optimize complex queries.

   b. Implement appropriate indexing.

   c. Consider using database-specific optimization techniques (e.g., PostgreSQL materialized views).
7. Implement efficient caching strategies:

   a. Set up Redis or a similar in-memory cache for frequently accessed data.

   b. Implement cache invalidation mechanisms to ensure data freshness.
8. Measure and document improvements in load times, data freshness, and overall application responsiveness.

## 4\. API Response Optimization

1. Implement JSON response compression:

   a. Use gzip or Brotli compression for API responses.

   b. Ensure Cloudflare is configured to respect and maintain compression.
2. Optimize response payload:

   a. Audit API responses to ensure only necessary data is being sent.

   b. Implement GraphQL for flexible data querying if appropriate.
3. Implement response caching where possible:

   a. Use Cache-Control headers effectively.

   b. Leverage Cloudflare's caching capabilities for static or infrequently changing responses.

## 5\. Error Handling and Monitoring

1. Implement comprehensive error handling across all API routes and middleware.
2. Set up detailed logging for backend operations:

   a. Use a structured logging format for easy parsing and analysis.

   b. Ensure sensitive information is not logged.
3. Integrate with existing Sentry setup for error tracking and performance monitoring:

   a. Set up custom performance traces for critical backend operations.

   b. Configure alerts for unusual error rates or performance degradations.

## 6\. Security Enhancements

1. Implement or review API rate limiting to prevent abuse.
2. Ensure all endpoints are properly authenticated and authorized.
3. Implement CORS policies appropriately for different environments.
4. Review and update input validation and sanitization across all API routes.

## 7\. Documentation

1. Update API documentation to reflect any changes made during optimization.
2. Document new patterns or best practices established during the optimization process.
3. Create or update runbooks for common backend operations and troubleshooting.

Throughout the optimization process, maintain close communication with the frontend team to ensure that backend changes are compatible with frontend requirements and to coordinate any necessary frontend updates.

data.title: Frontend Optimization
data.description:
Token Metrics is experiencing performance issues, as indicated by recent PageSpeed Insights reports. 

Key performance metrics such as Time to First Byte (TTFB), First Contentful Paint (FCP), Largest Contentful Paint (LCP), and Total Blocking Time (TBT) are below optimal thresholds. This issue aims to address these bottlenecks by outlining actionable tasks for the development team.

Current Performance Metrics:

```
•	Time to First Byte (TTFB): 1.5s (Goal: < 600ms)

•	First Contentful Paint (FCP): 9.3s (Goal: < 2.5s)

•	Largest Contentful Paint (LCP): 9.6s (Goal: < 2.5s)

•	Total Blocking Time (TBT): 1,470ms (Goal: < 300ms)
```

Start first optimizing the highest opportunity pages according to Sentry below.

[https://tokenmetrics-30.sentry.io/performance/?environment=production&statsPeriod=90d](https://tokenmetrics-30.sentry.io/performance/?environment=production&statsPeriod=90d)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/06c792c0-a832-4358-9499-01fc15814ad0/7d9f0df5-07a8-440a-bb60-a7a560ebd961)

Acceptance Criteria

```
•	Performance Goals Met:

•	TTFB is under 600ms.

•	FCP and LCP are under 2.5s.

•	TBT is under 300ms.

•	Functionality Unaffected:

•	All existing features work as before.

•	No new bugs or regressions introduced.

•	Code Quality Maintained:

•	All changes are reviewed and approved.

•	Code adheres to existing style guidelines.

•	Testing Completed:

•	All unit and integration tests pass.

•	New tests added for any new functionality.

•	Monitoring in Place:

•	Performance monitoring tools are active.

•	Alerts configured for performance regressions.
```

## 1\. Optimize large pages

1. Use the Next.js bundle analyzer to identify the largest components in `/[locale]/trading-bot/highest-rated`, `/[locale]/settings`, and `/[locale]/old/[...token]`.
2. For each identified large component:

   a. Implement dynamic imports using `next/dynamic`.

   b. Add loading states or skeletons for dynamically imported components.
3. Use the `priority` prop on `next/image` for above-the-fold images.
4. Implement virtualization for long lists using `react-window` or `react-virtualized`.
5. Run the bundle analyzer again and compare sizes. Aim for at least a 20% reduction.

## 2\. Reduce shared bundle size

1. Run `npm ls` to list all dependencies and their sizes.
2. Identify large or redundant packages.
3. Use a tool like `depcheck` to find unused dependencies.
4. Remove or replace large packages with lighter alternatives where possible.
5. Audit import statements across the project, replacing default imports with named imports where applicable.
6. Implement code splitting for large third-party libraries using dynamic imports.
7. Compare the new shared bundle size with the original. Target a 15-25% reduction.

## 3\. Analyze and optimize third-party libraries

1. Review the usage of '@stablelib/random' and identify why it's causing import issues.
2. If '@stablelib/random' is necessary, fix the import by using named imports instead of default import.
3. If it's not critical, find a lighter alternative or implement the functionality natively.
4. Use the `import cost` VS Code extension to identify other large imports.
5. For each large third-party library:

   a. Evaluate if it's necessary or if it can be replaced with a lighter alternative.

   b. If kept, ensure only necessary parts are imported.

   c. Consider lazy loading the library if it's not needed immediately.
6. Document changes made and their impact on bundle size.

comments.body: @ankit this is great progress, looking forward to the rest!

Hi @ian Here is the performance data from Sentry on the rating page
1/10 - 31/10

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/34e558ec-0cb9-4826-8f71-37c69e3fa95f/7b0c5ab3-49cd-46ae-9e20-9454349aef24)

14/11 - 6/12 (after using server-side pagination)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a29dde85-3ce0-4f9d-b20c-76dd16e0a428/19a8680a-12a8-4792-b948-fd51ba229842)

Next improvement: 

* New UI unifies FE and BE sorting and filtering (Most effective)
* Separate `total token` calculation (lazy-fetching API) (Easy to implement, potentially reducing time by 100-200ms)
* Cache prev-page and Pre-rendering next-pages (idea from @romes)
* Add more `cluster keys` (cc @paul @jake )
